items.description: An enhancement to the 'Manage what attendees see' feature allows organizers and presenters to preview changes to what is going to be displayed on or off the screen before sending the changes live to attendees. This capability is only available for Town hall.

items.title: Microsoft Purview Compliance Portal: Data Loss Prevention: DLP to restrict Microsoft 365 Copilot processing on emails with sensitivity labels
items.description: Microsoft Purview Data Loss Prevention (DLP) is extended to preventing Microsoft 365 Copilot from processing emails with sensitivity labels. This feature will allow DLP policies to provide detection of sensitivity labels in emails as enterprise grounding data and restrict access of the labeled emails in Microsoft 365 Copilot chat experiences.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Updates to video creation in Microsoft 365 Copilot
items.description: Quickly generate videos from a prompt, PowerPoint, PDF, or Word document with Create in the Microsoft 365 Copilot app—now with transcript-based editing, custom media from OneDrive, natural voiceovers, brand color integration, and a redesigned scene structure for faster, more professional storytelling.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Loss Prevention: UX improvements to the DLP Alerts in Purview Portal
items.description: We’re excited to announce UX improvements to the DLP Alerts Portal in Purview to help you triage incidents faster and more efficiently. What’s New: 1. Unified View: Events related to each alert are now available directly on the alerts page — no need to switch to new tab or drill down. 2. Faster Access: Access event details (e.g. Impacted assets) with just 1 click on the main alerts page itself, compared to 4 clicks earlier, reducing triage time significantly. 3. Enhanced Context: We've added 4 new columns - Location, DLP Rule name, DLP Policy name, Rule Action to display key alert and event attributes upfront — giving you more visibility at a glance. 4. Performance Boost: Cache improvements to ensure faster load times and a smoother experience. These updates are designed to streamline your workflow, reduce response times, and give you the context you need — all in a single, efficient view.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Loss Prevention: User based alert aggregation
items.description: User-Based Aggregation consolidates DLP alerts by user identity i.e. a DLP rule violations, in a specified aggregation time window, of the same rule and single user will be aggregated into a single alert enabling quicker triage and remediation. Instead of reviewing alerts containing rule match events of multiple users, DLP admin can now analyze grouped DLP rule match events per user, gaining insights into repeated policy violations and anomalous behavior.

items.title: Microsoft Intune: Windows Quality Update management policies
items.description: Manage individual Windows quality updates including non-Security and out of band updates.  Choose which update types to automatically approve and the rollout options for those approvals.

items.title: SharePoint: Content Management Assessment (CMA)
items.description:
The Content Management Assessment (CMA) helps tenant admins quickly evaluate site health, permissions, and lifecycle readiness—all in a single, actionable dashboard. It brings together multiple SAM reports, including Site Lifecycle Management (SLM) and Data Access Governance (DAG), and delivers clear, tailored recommendations to strengthen governance and prepare for Copilot onboarding.

How it works:
- CMA streamlines a process that was once manual and time-consuming:
- CMA automatically runs backend APIs to generate reports such as SLM and DAG.
- Results are presented in a clean, easy-to-read dashboard with actionable guidance.

Preview highlights:
- Clearer, more accessible UI
- Refined tooltips and issue categories
- Easier navigation across reports

Getting started:
1. Open the SharePoint Admin Center.
2. Go to Advanced Management.
3. Select “Start a free content assessment.”
4. Review results and explore tailored recommendations.
5. Share your feedback to help shape future improvements.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Glint - User Schema Enhancements - Custom Age and Tenure Derivations
items.description: This feature enables Viva Glint admins to create and manage custom age and tenure derivations directly within the platform. It empowers admins to easily update and maintain the structure of user data without requiring support.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Join town halls and webinars as an attendee from Microsoft Teams Rooms on Android
items.description: Microsoft Teams Rooms on Android can now join Town Halls in Teams as attendees. You can attend directly from the invited Teams Room, with the same features that attendees have for Town Halls on the Teams desktop app. Available in Teams Rooms Pro.

items.title: Excel: Formula completion with Copilot in Excel
items.description: This feature leverages AI to autocomplete the user's formula upon typing the '=' sign. It provides context-based suggestions, streamlining the formula creation process by offering intelligent and relevant completions.

items.title: Microsoft Purview Compliance Portal: Data Loss Prevention - Self-helper troubleshooting through Diagnostics page
items.description: Admin should be able to troubleshoot device health and policy sync health through Diagnostics page.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Insider Risk Management - Collection policies impact on IRM
items.description: With this update, Microsoft Purview will start supporting collection policies. Collection policies allow customers to scope classification (SITs - Sensitive Information Types) and activities for scoped users. We recommend reviewing collection policies as they can be created by different Purview solution admins to ensure they are setup to detect the activities required by Insider Risk Management policies Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, data leakage, and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies to manage security and compliance. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Copilot Dashboard - Broader access to M365 Copilot Chat insights
items.description: Microsoft Viva is expanding access to M365 Copilot Chat Insights in Microsoft Copilot Dashboard by enabling tenants with 1-49 M365 Copilot licenses- allowing more tenants, including those with fewer licenses, to track adoption trends. Insights will include usage over time, group level adoption, retention, app-level breakdowns, retention, and more. Users can filter by organizational attributes to uncover usage patterns.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: People count captured by Cloud IntelliFrame in the Pro Management portal reports
items.description: Admins get enhanced visibility into room usage from Pro Management portal reports with detailed occupancy data captured by Cloud IntelliFrame during meetings. This insight helps IT more effectively plan and optimize meeting spaces, and is currently available for Teams Rooms on Windows licensed with Teams Rooms Pro.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Insider Risk Management - Discovery of sensitive data sharing to any cloud application or website (inc. GenAI) via network layer
items.description: With this update, Insider Risk Management will support the discovery of sensitive files and text shared to any cloud application or website (inc. GenAI) via network layer. This capability is based on integration with 3rd party network partners (with data being captured via network layer). Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, data leakage, and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies based on their own internal policies, governance, and organizational requirements. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Insider Risk Management - Generative AI apps activities as triggers in IRM
items.description: With this update, the generative AI apps indicators will be supported as triggers in Risky AI usage policy. With triggers, customers can define the conditions for bringing the user into the scope of a policy while the generative AI apps indicators are used to determine risk score. Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, data leakage, and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies based on their own internal policies, governance, and organizational requirements. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Engage - Move conversation feature toggle
items.description: Engage admins and network admins can change access to the move conversation feature with this new toggle. This feature helps customers manage how messages move across communities. When disabled, only admins, corporate communicators, community admins, and community experts can move conversations. When enabled (default), any user with access to a conversation can move it.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Updates to OneDrive file browsing experience in the Microsoft 365 Copilot app on iPad and iPhone
items.description: Users on the Microsoft 365 Copilot app for iPad and iPhone devices will be directed to the standalone OneDrive app for file browsing and management. While users can still access their most recent files and search for OneDrive content within the Microsoft 365 Copilot app, advanced actions like folder navigation, permission settings, downloads, and deletions must be done in the OneDrive app.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Copilot Chat for Teams Chats, Channels, Calling and Meetings
items.description: Copilot Chat will soon be available for Teams chats, channels, calling and meetings.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot Chat-centered experience for creating new documents in the Microsoft 365 Copilot app on iPhone and iPad
items.description: In the Create experience in the Microsoft 365 Copilot app on iPhone and iPad, users will see a chat-centered experience to create documents, enabling them to describe the document they want to create in a prompt.

items.title: Microsoft Intune: Intune settings available in Catalog and Account Protection template for Adminless feature
items.description: Adminless settings able to be configured in settings catalog and account protection template.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Control External Access by Domain for Specific Users and Groups
items.description: Gain granular control over external communication. By setting custom External Access policies, you can define domain allow/deny lists and assign them to specific users or groups - capabilities that were previously tenant-wide only ("Teams and Skype for Business users in external organizations"). Use this to pilot with a department, restrict high‑risk roles to approved partners, or open federation broadly where appropriate. Example: Allow Group A to communicate only with a specific domain, while Group B can communicate with all external domains.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: User reporting for incorrectly identified security concerns
items.description: Microsoft Teams now allows users to report messages they believe were incorrectly flagged as security concerns. This feature is available in one-on-one chats, group and meeting chats, as well as public and private channels.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Generative-AI skills for Create in Microsoft 365 Copilot app for Government Clouds
items.description: Design and edit images, posters, banners, infographics, text drafts, and forms with Copilot—align them to your brand using kits built by you or your team.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Rich Bing web answer cards on M365 Copilot
items.description: M365 Copilot will be showing the rich and interactive Bing web answer cards like Weather, Stocks etc. to relevant queries to enrich the responses.

items.title: Outlook: Snooze, Pin and Ignore in the read pop-out ribbon in New Outlook and Outlook for Web
items.description: Snooze, pin, and ignore actions are available in the read pop-out ribbon in Outlook for Web and Windows to improve triage efficiency and user control. #newoutlookforwindows

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): [Copilot Chat] Search based user RSVP status
items.description: Users will be able to search for meetings based on Self RSVP and Others RSVP status in Copilot Chat. Example prompts for a user looking for their own RSVP status include: "Meetings I have accepted/declined/marked tentative for today" "Did I accept Project OKR review meeting" "List all events I have not RSVPed". Example prompts for a user looking for other individuals' RSVP status include: "List RSVP status of attendees for the review meeting" "Who all have accepted the next meeting?" "Will Sarah attend Project review meet?"

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Endpoint Data Loss Prevention - Endpoint DLP support classification of Azure RMS protected Office documents
items.description: Endpoint DLP can now classify Office files stored in Windows devices that have Azure RMS protection applied.  Classification will be triggered when file is used in applications or when just-in-time classification is enabled

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): [Copilot Chat] Launch the full Microsoft 365 Copilot app when using Copilot Chat in the Microsoft 365 apps
items.description: When using the Copilot Chat side pane in Microsoft 365 apps, users will be able to launch the full Microsoft 365 Copilot app from a dedicated button. Additionally, accessing some features in the side pane will launch the full app.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Reference a Loop or Page when creating a presentation with Copilot
items.description: You can now reference a Loop or Page when you create a presentation with Copilot within the PowerPoint application.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Reference a Loop or Page when creating a presentation with Copilot
items.description: You can now reference a Loop or Page when you create a presentation with Copilot within the PowerPoint application.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Reference a Loop or Page when creating a presentation with Copilot
items.description: You can now reference a Loop or Page when you create a presentation with Copilot within the PowerPoint application.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: New Organization chart in the Profile Card for Web and Desktop
items.description: With the new org chart users will not only be able to contextaulize a person, they will also be able to scroll through visited profiles, see a manager's reports counts, and more.

items.title: SharePoint: Updated Document Library User Experience
items.description: We're updating the SharePoint document library experience to more closely align with the user experience in OneDrive - while making it easier than ever before to access the valuable functionality unique to document libraries. When you’re working in a document library, we’ve brought custom views and filters front and center – just like in OneDrive. We’ve also redesigned the command bar to help you take action, faster. All your view customization tools are now grouped under one simplified menu, making it easy to apply conditional formatting or organize items by metadata in seconds.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: App Deployment in Teams Admin Center
items.description: We're introducing a new admin setting that replaces the Installed apps section in app setup policies, enabling more streamlined per-app deployment control.  With controls to pre-install the app for : all users, specific users and groups, or no users.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: AI Workflows in Workflows app
items.description: With AI Workflows in the Workflows app, you will have access to custom AI-powered templates to automate complex tasks and streamline daily operations. AI Workflows enhance productivity by simplifying task execution and helping users stay organized throughout the day. Admins can enable this feature to equip users with intelligent automation tools that make managing work more efficient and intuitive.

items.title: Outlook: Automatic Draft Minimize
items.description: When users close a draft in progress, it automatically minimizes instead of closing completely. The minimized draft can now be quickly accessed via a button that appears in the message list.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Loss Prevention - Expanding access to Diagnostics to Compliance Administrator, Security Administrator and Organization Management
items.description: We are expanding the access to Diagnostics beyond Global Admin to: Compliance Administrator, Security Administrator and Organization Management.

items.title: Microsoft 365: eSignature Smart Tagging for Electronically Signed Documents
items.description: Documents that have been electronically signed will now be automatically recognized and tagged as “Signed” upon upload to SharePoint. This enhancement also applies retroactively as existing e-signed files will be updated with the appropriate tags. To give users more visibility and control, we’re introducing two optional metadata columns for document libraries: Electronically Signed – Indicates whether a document has been eSigned. Signature Provider – Displays the service used for the eSignature. This feature is available exclusively to tenants with eSignature enabled, helping streamline compliance tracking and document management.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Graph APIs for Standard eDiscovery Cases
items.description: Releasing Graph APIs supporting case management, search management and export for tenants with standard eDiscovery licenses.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Private channels increased limits and transition to group compliance
items.description: We are updating private channels to align with compliance model for all channels. After this change, compliance policies applied to the team (M365 Group) will apply to all channels in the team - across standard, private, and shared. Private channels will no longer need user level targeting of policies different from other channels, and private channel compliance messages will no longer be copied to user mailboxes, relying on a dedicated, internal mailbox per channel like shared channels. In addition, limits for private channels will be increased so each team can have more than 30 private channels, up to the 1000 total channel limit per team. Private channel member limits will increase from 250 to 5000. You will also be able to schedule meetings in private channels.

items.title: Outlook: Chat for Outlook iOS and Android
items.description:
On phone devices, users currently access Copilot Chat in Outlook Mobile via a tab at the bottom of their screen (or in Apps). Outlook is introducing a new Copilot Chat overlay experience, allowing users to chat with Copilot while continuing to interact with their email, calendar, and contacts. This overlay will be context-aware—understanding what the user is viewing—so users can ask Copilot about the content on their screen. 

Users with M365 Copilot licenses will also benefit from Copilot’s ability to  draw on Microsoft 365 Graph to provide richer, more personalized responses.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Surveys Agent helps you build, run, and analyze surveys
items.description: Surveys Agent is your expert companion in Microsoft 365 Copilot for building smarter surveys—start to finish. From crafting the survey, launching and collecting data, or analyzing results, Surveys Agent is there to guide you every step of the way. It’s like having a professional survey designer and data analyst at your fingertips—so you can focus on making confident, insight-driven decisions.

items.title: Microsoft Intune: Additional granular RBAC controls to manage Antivirus, Firewall, BitLocker, and Endpoint Detection and Response endpoint security workloads
items.description: Expanded granular RBAC controls to manage Endpoint Security workloads. The ‘Security baselines’ permission previously included all security policies and now all security workloads have their own permission set

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): [Copilot Extensibility] View Index browser, schema and errors for Custom Connectors on MAC
items.description: View index browser, schema, and the errors for custom connectors from the M365 Admin center for better troubleshooting.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Dynamic video tile resizing based on occupancy count from Teams Rooms on Android
items.description: The room video tile dynamically adjusts size based on the number of people in the room. When one person is in the room, the tile matches the remote participant's size. With two or more people, the room tile expands to be four times larger. Admins can enable or disable the people count feature.

items.title: Microsoft 365 Copilot: Initiate Copilot Chat by sharing files to the Microsoft 365 Copilot app on iPhone and iPad
items.description: When users on iPhone and iPad choose the action to share a Word, Excel, or PowerPoint file from a third party app (including Files) and choose Microsoft 365 Copilot as the target app, the file will be uploaded to chat. Users will then have the option to open a preview of the file or continue their conversation with Copilot Chat.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Preview and chat with Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint files in the Microsoft 365 Copilot app on iPhone
items.description: When opening a Microsoft Word, Excel, or PowerPoint file in the Microsoft 365 Copilot app on iPhone, users will get a preview experience where they can use Copilot Chat to command and ask questions about the files directly in the preview. This enables immediate access to Copilot Chat in a user's file.

items.title: Outlook: File tab in Ribbon
items.description: The File tab provides new Outlook users with the ability to easily discover account info, settings, PSTs, and more directly from the ribbon. #newoutlookforwindows

items.title: Microsoft Purview Compliance Portal: Collection policies support in IRM
items.description: With this update, IRM will start supporting collection policies. Collection policies allow customers to scope classification (SITs - Sensitive Information Types) and activities for scoped users. For device indicators based IRM policy, required collection policies will be automatically created in the background. Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, data leakage, and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies to manage security and compliance. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot Chat - Session Persistence Enhancement
items.description: This feature ensures that conversations are preserved even when users navigate away from a session. As soon as a prompt is submitted, an entry is immediately created in the navigation pane’s session history. This allows users to leave the session and return later just as if they had never left. The update enhances continuity and reliability, making it easier to navigate without losing progress.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Collaborate using Pages in Channels
items.description: We are bringing Pages to your Teams Channel experience. Create and collaborate using Pages directly in any of your channels.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Raise hands in Town Hall
items.description: Currently in a Teams Town hall, attendees cannot raise their hands and share their microphone and camera as they can in a meeting. With this new update, town halls organized by users with Teams Premium will allow attendees to raise their hand like they would in a standard Teams meeting. The ability to raise a hand can signal to organizers and presenters, who can then bring attendees on screen to allow them to share their camera and microphone.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot Chat - Support for emails in ContextIQ
items.description: Users can include an email in their prompt as a reference by typing '/' and selecting one from the ContextIQ menu when using either the full app or side pane Copilot Chat experience in Outlook. Copilot Chat will reference the included email as part of its response. This feature applies to users without a Microsoft 365 Copilot license (Copilot Chat users) and to users with a license (Microsoft 365 Copilot users) when they are toggled to web scope in chat.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Malicious URL Protection for Teams Chat and Channels
items.description: Microsoft Teams can now detect and warn users on malicious URLs sent in Teams chat and channels, increasing protection against malware attacks.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Weaponizable File Type Protection for Teams Chat and Channels
items.description: Microsoft Teams now blocks messages containing weaponizable file types, such as executables, in chats and channels, increasing protection against malware and other file-based attacks.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Facilitator agent for scheduled meetings in Teams Rooms
items.description: You can take advantage of the Facilitator agent in Teams Rooms on Windows or Android for real-time AI-generated notes, follow up items, and keeping everyone on time during scheduled meetings. Facilitator appears in the meeting chat and participants can toggle between notes, chat, and the agent.  Available in rooms licensed for Teams Rooms Pro. Facilitator for ad-hoc meetings, invoked by QR code scan, is available in public preview.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Copilot Analytics - Copilot Employee Experience Outcomes Report with Viva Glint
items.description: A new Power BI report in Viva Insights highlights the relationships and impact of M365 Copilot usage on employee experience sentiment outcomes in Viva Glint. This report enables robust analysis by allowing users to slice and dice data based on Copilot usage segments, different sentiment outcomes and organizational attributes. #copilotcontrolsystem

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Larger file upload support in Copilot Studio agent builder
items.description: Copilot Studio agent builder in Microsoft 365 will support larger file uploads of up to 512 MB.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Copilot Analytics - Unified Exclusion list
items.description: Unified Exclusion Lists in Copilot Analytics provide a single, streamlined way for admins to exclude users—both unlicensed and licensed—from all Viva Insights reports and Copilot Dashboard. This ensures consistent, privacy-compliant data control across the entire platform. Admins can manage exclusions easily through one list, simplifying configuration and safeguarding sensitive user data without impacting other organizational HR data.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Immersive events in Microsoft Teams
items.description: Host interactive virtual events with avatars in customizable 3D spaces. Schedule immersive events from your Teams calendar and join events directly in Microsoft Teams on PC or Mac. Organizers can customize an immersive event's 3D space with images, videos, and 3D models, no coding skills required. Attendees can mingle in the 3D space and engage with different features that provide a rich interactive experience.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Glint - Export Executive Summary report in Viva Glint to editable PowerPoint slides
items.description: Managers will be able to export the default sections from the Executive Summary report in Viva Glint directly to editable PowerPoint slides. This enhancement allows for easier and quicker consumption of this report outside Viva Glint, compared to the previous export method which included static screenshots.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Simplified device settings for voice and face recognition on Teams Rooms
items.description: It's easier for admins to enable the benefits of intelligent audio and video and Copilot for users in Teams Rooms through a new user interface, and admin settings. These new settings, on the device and in the Pro Management portal, simplify configuration and remove the requirement to use PowerShell, offering improved visibility across rooms.

items.title: Microsoft Purview Compliance Portal: Expanding access to Diagnostics to Compliance Administrator, Security Administrator and Organization Management
items.description: We are expanding the access to Diagnostics beyond Global Admin to: Compliance Administrator, Security Administrator and Organization Management

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Admin control for org-wide agent sharing
items.description: Admins can manage who can create org-wide agent sharing links for agents built in Copilot Studio Agent Builder for improved governance and flexibility of agent sharing. #copilotcontrolsystem

items.title: Microsoft Edge: v.140 - HTTPS First Mode
items.description: HTTPS-First Mode in Microsoft Edge automatically upgrades HTTP connections to HTTPS when possible.  If a site doesn’t support HTTPS, Microsoft Edge shows a warning to highlight the security risk. This appears only for public sites—not private ones or manually entered HTTP URLs. Users can enable the warning in edge://settings and admins can control availability to this feature using the HttpsOnlyMode policy.

items.title: Microsoft 365: Microsoft 365 companion apps- a suite of apps designed to enhance productivity
items.description: Microsoft 365 companions is a suite of apps, including People, File Search, and Calendar, designed to enhance productivity through quick access to key tools directly from the Windows 11 taskbar. These lightweight apps integrate seamlessly with Microsoft 365, allowing users to efficiently look up contacts and navigate organization charts, locate files, view calendars and streamline workflows without distractions.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Intelligent recap for DoD
items.description: Intelligent meeting recap uses AI to provide a quick summary of your meeting, highlighting key discussion points, identifying follow-up actions, and offering quick access to significant points such as name mentions, when a screen was shared, individualized speaker markers, topics, and chapters.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Support for multiple camera views and IntelliFrame from Teams Rooms on Windows in Teams webinar and structured meetings
items.description: Multiple camera views and IntelliFrame (Multi-stream and cloud) from Teams Rooms on Windows are now available in Teams webinar and structured meetings with "Manage what attendees see" enabled. Organizers and presenters of these meetings can access intelligent camera views and bring them on the live stage for attendees.  Available with Teams Rooms Pro.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Live caption translation in Teams Rooms on Android
items.description: Users can now choose the translation language you prefer without affecting what other meeting participants see in Teams Rooms on Android. Currently, live captions display in the spoken language by default, this change allows individuals to select their own experience. This feature is available on Teams Rooms Pro.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Customize captions on Mobile
items.description: Live captions are now available on mobile devices with enhanced customization options, making captions easier to read and follow during meetings. You can personalize your captions by adjusting the font color, caption background color, and caption height. These enhancements ensure captions remain accessible and comfortable, especially under varying lighting conditions or when you're on the go.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Insider Risk Management - Personal email triggers
items.description:
In this update, we are adding the recently added email indicators in Insider Risk Management as triggers. 1.  Sending email with attachments to free public domains - Users will be brought into scope of a policy when business-sensitive data is potentially leaked from a work email account to a free public domain email, potentially leading to a data security incident.  2. Sending email with attachments to self - Users will be brought into scope of a policy when business-sensitive data is potentially leaked from a work email account to user's personal email account or emailing self, potentially leading to a data security incident. 
Admins with appropriate permissions can enable these indicators from the settings page and use these triggers in the data leaks or data leaks by priority users template.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Tip Support in Outlook for Mac
items.description: DLP policy tips for Microsoft Outlook for Mac provide real-time notifications to users when their email contains sensitive information that violates organizational policies. Users can see policy tips directly in the mail tip UI and have the option to remove non-compliant recipients or override the policy if necessary. This feature ensures compliance by alerting users to potential data loss risks before sending emails.

items.title: OneNote: Microsoft Purview Sensitivity Labels in OneNote
items.description: Microsoft Purview Sensitivity Labels in OneNote will allow users to classify and protect OneNote Sections with the same compliance standards available across Microsoft 365 apps. Users will be able to apply labels directly within OneNote, ensuring sensitive content is encrypted, access-controlled, and compliant with the organization's policies.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Storyline & Post Enhancements, Cover Photos, Drafts, AMAs, and More
items.description: Over the course of the next few months, you’ll see a set of updates that make it easier to create, manage, and personalize posts in Viva Engage. These include Storyline cover photos and featured posts to further customize your Storyline page, the ability to draft and schedule posts in advance, support for AMAs, and the ability for a delegate to post-on-behalf-of on Storyline. Whether you're a communicator, leader, or team member, these features will help you engage your audience with greater clarity and customizations.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Cloud IntelliFrame support on Teams Rooms on Android
items.description: Now Cloud IntelliFrame, the AI-based cloud technology that optimizes views of in-room participants for hybrid meetings, is available for Teams Rooms on Android using group framing. It is set as the default in those rooms, while remaining disabled by default in others. Admins can manage this behavior through console settings.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Copilot Dashboard - M365 Copilot Chat adoption metrics
items.description: Insights on M365 Copilot Chat adoption for users not licensed for M365 Copilot. Insights will include usage trends over time, adoption by group, retention, and app level breakdowns. Users can filter by organizational attributes to uncover adoption patterns. Admins can disable M365 Copilot Chat insights in Microsoft Admin Center.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Live event using Teams Town hall in Viva Engage
items.description: Community admins can now produce or stream their broadcasts using Teams Town hall, offering higher-quality production and enhanced functionality.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Voice chat in Microsoft 365 Copilot
items.description: Voice in Microsoft 365 Copilot brings a natural, hands-free conversational experience to your desktop and mobile devices – enabling you to talk to Copilot like a colleague, unlocking a faster, more intuitive way to work. Speak directly to M365 Copilot to search for information, catch up between meetings, brainstorm out loud, and do it all in multiple languages.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Chat Notes
items.description: A new collaborative space is now available directly from your Teams chat, enabling real-time collaboration, organization of key information, and streamlined communications. Chat notes is available in 1:1 and group chat, and is accessible only to the chat members. Add images, format text, share Loop components, and mention chat members when you require their attention.

items.title: Outlook: Send Button update
items.description: This feature reduces accidental message sends by moving the send button from the bottom of the compose view, in the compose toolbar to the header of the compose view. By moving the send button to a less crowded location, users can avoid accidental taps, resulting in a more intentional and error-free messaging experience.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Enhanced privacy and stability for live captions
items.description: To improve privacy, when transcription is off, captions will now show only the past five minutes of dialogue instead of the full meeting. If transcription is on, captions display the entire conversation, just like with live transcription. We’re also fixing an issue where changing the caption position could cause data loss—now, moving captions will not affect the text shown. These updates also apply to Real-time Text (RTT), ensuring a consistent and reliable experience.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Copilot Analytics - Copilot Studio agent report in Insights enhanced with autonomous agents.
items.description: Enhancement to Copilot studio agents report (Viva Insights) - 1. Inclusion of agents with "generative" orchestration 2. Autonomous agent adoption and impact (maker led time and cost saving).

items.title: Outlook: New Scheduling and Event Creation Experience
items.description: The Outlook and Teams calendars will receive an update to the scheduling and event creation experience. Additionally, new capabilities will be available in this new experience to help streamline and enhance scheduling using Copilot. #newoutlookforwindows

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Update document sections from new sources
items.description: Easily refresh parts of your document using content from other files—without copying and pasting. Copilot keeps your formatting intact while pulling in the latest updates from new sources.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot Chat Tools Control
items.description: Tools acts as a lightweight entry point into high-value, task-specific Copilot features and capabilities directly from the prompt box. By selecting Tools, users get a menu where they can easily discover and trigger the right Copilot feature or capability for their current task, while also providing consistent interactions across tools.

items.title: Microsoft Edge: Ground Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat in Edge for Business in your open YouTube videos
items.description: Get relevant answers and insights about your open YouTube videos in Copilot Chat in Edge.

items.title: Microsoft Edge: Ground Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat in Edge for Business in your open OneDrive and SharePoint documents
items.description: Get relevant answers and insights about your open cloud documents in Copilot Chat in Edge.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Harmful Content Protection Controls in Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat
items.description: We’re introducing a new policy setting in Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat that gives administrators enhanced control over how users interact with harmful content protection. This feature is designed to support specialized roles—such as legal, investigative, or moderation teams—where exposure to sensitive content may be necessary.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Agent Mode in Word for Enhanced document editing
items.description: Copilot supports document editing in Word through chat-based interactions with Agent Mode. Users can initiate edits, share clarifying directions, and review a summary of changes within the document.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): [Copilot Chat] Email attachment summarization (Modern Attachments)
items.description: Users will be able to reason over additional attachment content, along with the email body, in Copilot Chat. Support will be extended to Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Pdf, Text, Json and Xml files mentioned in the email as links (Modern Attachments).

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): [Copilot Chat] Email attachment summarization (Classic Attachments)
items.description: Now users will be able to reason over attached content along with the body of the email in Copilot Chat. Supported file types are Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Pdf, Text, Json and Xml attached to the email (Classic Attachments).

items.title: SharePoint: Updates to News page in SharePoint sites
items.description: The News page renders news items in a given site. It is typically accessed via the "see all" experience of a news web part.  We are updating the user experience of this page and bringing in Copilot capabilities to licensed users. Updated February 9, 2026: GA rollout for this item is starting in late February. We apologize for any inconvenience.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Endpoint Data Loss Prevention -- Always-on diagnostics for macOS endpoints (Phase 1)
items.description: This feature release ‘Always-on diagnostics’, captures critical diagnostic data from onboarded endpoint devices running on macOS for EDLP issue reporting. Comprehensive trace logs will be automatically recorded and stored locally on onboarded Mac devices, eliminating the need to reproduce issues when submitting investigation requests to Microsoft. It allows for the collection of detailed traces over extended periods (up to 90 days). While raising tickets to submit investigation requests to Microsoft regarding Microsoft Endpoint DLP, customers can share enhanced diagnostic information with Microsoft without needing to reproduce the exact scenario.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Endpoint Data Loss Prevention -- Always-on diagnostics for Windows Endpoints (Phase 2)
items.description: Admins can retrieve diagnostic 'Always-on diagnostic' traces directly from Windows endpoints and selectively upload them to Microsoft through the Purview Portal at the time of an investigation request such as submitting a support ticket, without disrupting end users or impacting their productivity. This eliminates the need for user coordination while maintaining seamless troubleshooting capabilities

items.title: Microsoft Edge: v. 140 - Tab Groups – Auto-Save and Easy Revisit
items.description: Microsoft Edge now automatically saves tab groups, making it easier than ever for users to pick up where they left off. Organized tab groups are preserved and ready to revisit anytime, whether a user is switching tasks or restarting the browser.  Admins can control the availability of the feature using the “SyncTypesListDisabled” policy with the “openTabs” data type.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Share meeting recap to SharePoint
items.description: Meeting organizers and presenters can share meeting recap notes and follow-up tasks directly from Teams to SharePoint as a news post, facilitating the seamless sharing of post meeting follow-up details.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Generating PPT grounded on a Copilot Page
items.description: Generating PPT grounded on a Copilot Page

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Enhancement to Copilot studio agents report
items.description: Following further review, this feature continues in development. We apologize for any inconvenience. Enhancement to Copilot studio agents report (Preview) 1. Addition of Weekly active user count 2. Report aggregation changed to weekly to main consistency with other reports

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Copilot Dashboard - Copilot Chat in Word, Excel, PowerPoint Metrics
items.description: Copilot Analytics users can now view metrics that reflect Copilot Chat (Work and Web) activity across Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. These updates reflect the latest addition of Copilot Chat to these apps to help users transition seamlessly between workflows and will be displayed alongside existing app chat metrics for continuity. The updated metrics are available in the Copilot Dashboard, the M365 Copilot Adoption and Impact PBI reports, with additional query support for all chat prompt metrics.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot Dashboard: Copilot Chat (Web) in Teams & Outlook metrics
items.description: Copilot Analytics users can now view metrics about their Copilot Chat (Web) usage in Teams and Outlook. These updates enable users to better understand both active usage and action counts in Teams and Outlook and will be available in the Copilot Dashboard, as well as with additional query support.

items.title: Microsoft Intune: Intune Suite - Unattended Remote Help for Windows - Remote Sign-in
items.description: Remotely access devices over the cloud without requiring end user involvement by signing in with credentials.

items.title: Microsoft Intune: Intune Suite - Support approvals can now be requested by non-primary users of a device.
items.description: We're updating Endpoint Privilege Management to allow users who are not assigned as the primary user of a device to initiate support approval requests. Previously, these requests would fail, but with this change, they will be processed successfully.

items.title: Microsoft Intune: Intune Suite - Endpoint Privilege Management Virtual Account Support
items.description: EPM will introduce a per-rule option to run elevated apps with the original user's identity context, preserving app data, save locations, and preferences. This offers a more personalized app runtime experience compared to the default virtual account.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Enhanced personalization with memory in Copilot
items.description: Microsoft 365 Copilot will improve memory in Copilot by increasing the relevance and quality of Copilot responses based on previous communications. This AI-powered capability improves the relevance and quality of Copilot responses by learning from previous communications. These memories are private to the user.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Save an audio overview from Copilot Notebooks to OneDrive
items.description: Save the audio overview that you have generated within a Copilot Notebook to OneDrive so you can download or share with others.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Configurate format, style, and duration of Audio Overviews in Copilot Notebooks
items.description: Users can guide Copilot on the format (podcast-style with dual voices or a single voice), style, and duration while generating an Audio Overview of their Copilot Notebook.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Audio Overview customization in Copilot Notebooks
items.description: Guide the content of an Audio Overview created for a Copilot Notebook through natural language input.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Updated UI for Copilot Chat Navigation Pane in Outlook
items.description: The navigation pane has been repositioned from the right side to the left, offering a more intuitive layout. Despite the shift, it continues to host agents and conversation history, ensuring continuity in user experience. This redesign introduces new features, including access to the "All Conversations" page, which provides a comprehensive view of chat history. The change aims to enhance usability and streamline navigation within Copilot Chat.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Updated UI for the Copilot Chat Navigation Pane in Teams
items.description: The navigation pane has been repositioned from the right side to the left, offering a more intuitive layout. Despite the shift, it continues to host agents and conversation history, ensuring continuity in user experience. This redesign introduces new features, including access to the "All Conversations" page, which provides a comprehensive view of chat history. The change aims to enhance usability and streamline navigation within Copilot Chat.

items.title: SharePoint: eSignature - Free Text Field Support
items.description: SharePoint eSignature users would be able to add custom free text fields to their request documents. This new eSignature field can be used to request information (such as address, full name, etc.) from signers.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): [Copilot Extensibility] Delete Schema Properties via Copilot Connector APIs
items.description:
We’re adding support for property deletion in custom Copilot connectors, giving admins and developers more control over schema evolution. With this feature, you can:
* Use Copilot connector APIs to delete or drop individual schema properties that are no longer needed.
* Keep your connector schema clean and up-to-date without requiring full re-ingestion.
* Reduce developer overhead and simplify maintenance workflows as your data models evolve.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): [Copilot Extensibility] Connector Metadata Enrichment for Custom Copilot Connectors
items.description:
We’re introducing new options that allow admins and developers to enrich their custom Copilot connectors and its schema properties with descriptive metadata.
With this update, you can now: * Provide richer context about the connection and its schema properties to Copilot’s LLM, enabling more accurate and relevant responses. Add alternate names, data source categories, common actions to your connector and description for schema properties. * Improve search and chat quality by helping Copilot better understand the semantics and purpose of your data.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): [Copilot Extensibility] Simplified People Resolution for Custom Copilot Connectors
items.description:
This feature enables connectors to resolve external identities—such as email addresses or user IDs from third-party data sources—to their corresponding Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) identities. By allowing flexible identity mapping, developers can:
* Simplify integration workflows without needing complex Graph API lookups.
* Reduce setup friction by avoiding strict dependency on object IDs.
* Improve search and chat relevance in Copilot by ensuring accurate people attribution across connected systems.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): [Copilot Extensibility] Schema Recommendations for Custom Connectors in M365 Admin Center
items.description:
Accelerate your custom connector development with intelligent schema guidance directly in the Microsoft 365 Admin Center. This feature provides:
* Proposed schema suggestions tailored to the connector you’re building.
* Real-time recommendations to identify gaps or errors in your schema design to help improve search and chat results in Copilot.
Whether you're starting from scratch or refining an existing connector, this enhancement ensures your schema is optimized for Copilot extensibility and performance.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): [Copilot Extensibility] Full refresh of custom connectors datasource
items.description: Admins and developers can do a full refresh or sync of their datasource for Custom Connectors using Graph APIs. This also ensures that any items deleted in the source are automatically deleted during this full sync and admins do not have to use separate delete APIs to do this.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): [Copilot Extensibility] Customize icons and display names for custom Copilot connectors
items.description:
1. Add or Customize icons for Custom Copilot connectors using the Graph API or from the M365 Admin Center. 
2. Add or Customize display names for Custom Copilot connectors using the Graph API or from the M365 Admin Center.

items.title: Microsoft Edge: Add “Summarize” and “Explain” Copilot actions in PDF reader
items.description: Microsoft Edge will expand its existing “Ask Copilot” integration in the built-in PDF reader by introducing two new actions — “Summarize” and “Explain.” These options will allow users to generate a concise overview or simplify complex content within a PDF or selected portion. The new actions build on the existing “Ask Copilot” integration and follow the same enterprise controls and policies.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Search for meetings
items.description: You can now search by meeting name or participant, take direct actions like joining, RSVPing, or viewing recaps, and access a dedicated Meetings tab for a streamlined experience. These updates make it easier to find and act on meetings right from the search bar.

items.title: Planner: Information Barrier support in Planner
items.description: Information Barrier (IB) support in Microsoft Planner will enable organizations to restrict access to plans and tasks based on user groups.  IB will help prevent data leakage, enforce internal policies, and support regulatory mandates by limiting plan visibility and collaboration to authorized segments.

items.title: Microsoft Purview Compliance Portal: Information Protection- Scan existing files in SharePoint and OneDrive for business for sensitive information
items.description: This new capability will enable admins to scan existing files at rest in SharePoint or OneDrive for business for sensitive data.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): On-Canvas Copilot and Private Preview in Shared Pages
items.description: After making changes to a shared page via chat or on-canvas Copilot, responses appear as private previews, showing content suggestions that you can edit and preview privately before applying them.

items.title: Viva Glint - Action Taking Analysis Report
items.description: Introduction of a new report that provides transparency into platform activity by dashboard users. Metrics such as report views, Team Conversations completed, Focus Areas created, and more will be visible and filterable with this report.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Focus Area simplification and enhancements
items.description: Beginning with this feature release, Focus Areas will be associated with survey cycles and goal periods will be retired. Users will be able to select the same Focus Area across multiple cycles. The Focus Area Overview report will be filterable to groups of interest (e.g. managers only). Draft/deleted Focus Areas will no longer be included in Focus Area calculations.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Regional Settings Separation
items.description: Regional Settings Separation in Microsoft Teams is designed to give users full control over UI language, date, and time formats - either synced with their OS or set manually - for a seamless, globally personalized experience that also addresses common synchronization issues.

items.title: Outlook: Customizable Oversharing dialog for DLP in New Outlook
items.description: New Outlook for Windows will now support ability to show customizable oversharing dialog for Data Loss Prevention. The support will be to configure custom title, body, business justifications, and dynamic variables/tokens for matched recipients, attachment names, and labels. #newoutlookforwindows

items.title: Outlook: Wait on Send for oversharing dialog in New Outlook
items.description:
New Outlook for Windows will now support Wait on Send for Oversharing.
This feature allows admins to block sending of emails in case DLP policy evaluation is not completed for labeled or sensitive content. #newoutlookforwindows

items.title: Microsoft Purview Compliance Portal: Information Protection - Admin unit scoping in Content Explorer and Data Explorer
items.description: This feature introduces Admin Unit scoping to both Content Explorer and Data Explorer, enabling more granular visibility and control over M365 data. It ensures that data exploration respects organizational boundaries defined by Admin Units, enhancing compliance and governance.

items.title: Microsoft Purview Compliance Portal: Information Protection - Admin unit scoping in Content Explorer and Data Explorer
items.description: This feature introduces Admin Unit scoping to both Content Explorer and Data Explorer, enabling more granular visibility and control over M365 data. It ensures that data exploration respects organizational boundaries defined by Admin Units, enhancing compliance and governance.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Dedicated download option for tracking all registrations in Webinar
items.description: Event organizers can now download a distinct registration report (separate from an attendee list) from the Reports section of a Webinar, in order to have visibility and information about all registrants for a particular webinar instance.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Filtering Conversation History
items.description: We’re introducing a chat history filtering capability that empowers users to tailor their view of past conversations. This feature enables users to scope their chat history to a more relevant, workflow-aligned view, helping them quickly surface the chats that matters most. This enhancement is designed to support better context recall.

items.title: Word: 3rd party citation add-in in reference tab
items.description: This integrates popular third-party citation providers under the Word Reference tab, helping users efficiently complete their reference lists.

items.title: Outlook: Global Address List Redesign
items.description: The Global Address List, or Address Book, is getting a major visual redesign to make it easier to navigate, show more contact information in the search results list, improve its accessibility, and improve its appearance overall. This window is accessible via the To/Cc/Bcc buttons in the email compose form. #newoutlookforwindows

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Emoji Reactions Workflows
items.description: Seamlessly set up workflows started by emoji reactions in Teams. When a user reacts to a message with an emoji, the workflow will be kicked off to handle support tickets or start a helpdesk workflow.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Endpoint Data Loss Prevention - Ability to fetch the original file resulting in policy match as evidence (Microsoft Managed storage)
items.description: With this capability, Admins can choose to store a copy of the file that resulted in a DLP policy match. The admin uses this data to analyze the contents to confirm the full set of data that was exfiltrated to assess severity. To configure Microsoft managed storage, similar to customer managed storage, the user can go to endpoint DLP settings and select Microsoft managed storage. As compared to customer managed storage - the admin need not configure any additional settings like adding a blob, assigning permissions, selecting storage in policy workflow.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Generate a formula with Copilot from the grid upon "="
items.description:
This feature is no longer accurate and being removed from the roadmap because the functionality is available in Agent Mode in Excel.
Type “=” anywhere on your grid or in the formula bar and let Copilot generate formulas from natural language, making complex calculations simpler and faster.

items.title: Microsoft Intune: Application Control for Business
items.description: Application Control for Business in Intune has built-in controls and XML upload of WDAC policies and now supports targeting Managed Installer to specific groups instead of the entire tenant.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Recent activity is part of Copilot's dynamic document snapshot in Word
items.description: Select the Activity tab within the Copilot summary at the top of a document for a summary of recent comments and changes. Choose a time window of 3 days, 1 week, or 2 weeks.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Auto-update document sections from new sources
items.description: Easily refresh parts of your document using content from other files—without copying and pasting. Copilot keeps your formatting intact while pulling in the latest updates from new sources.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Press and hold Win + C or Copilot key to activate voice on the Microsoft 365 Copilot app
items.description: Press and hold Win + C keys, or the dedicated Copilot key for applicable devices, and the Microsoft 365 Copilot app will activate voice. With voice, talk to Copilot like a personal assistant - interrupting and redirecting at any time to prepare for the workday, create documents, understand topics, and search for information. This shortcut to activate voice means you don't have to switch between screens to talk with Copilot. Enterprise-grade security and compliance are built in, so conversations stay private while productivity soars.

items.title: Microsoft Edge: v.140 - Improved Navigation to Extension Surfaces
items.description: To improve visibility and discoverability, Microsoft Edge is introducing two navigation improvements for extensions.  First, if a user has at least one enabled extension, the puzzle icon will be persistent on the toolbar.  Second, from the Settings and more menu, the Extensions option will allow users to reach edge://extensions and the Edge Add-ons Store directly.

items.title: SharePoint: eSignature - globally available
items.description: Microsoft's native eSignature service allows users to request simple electronic signatures from Word & PDF documents in SharePoint. Recipients can easily sign documents without the documents leaving the trusted boundaries of Microsoft. This capability will be now be available in all markets with the exception of China, Indonesia and Türkiye.

items.title: Outlook: Save an Event as a Draft on Android
items.description: You can save a meeting as a draft on your calendar if you aren't ready to send the meeting invites. When composing an event with at least one attendee added, select dismiss and then select Save as a Draft. The draft event will show on your calendar as [Draft] along with the title of the event.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Pulse - New Pulse customization options
items.description: Authors will have new options when starting surveys, including choosing to send without pre-defining an audience, and feedback can instead be gathered by sharing a link that people can access the survey and respond through, sending a survey without a specified end date, allowing for longer-term data collection and multiple responses from recipients over time, and collecting identified responses, where answers are attributed to the person who submitted them.

items.title: Microsoft Clipchamp: Updated Clipchamp video start page
items.description: The Clipchamp start page new unified hub is a revamped video hub start page experience of a single video destination for creation, discovery & consumption.

items.title: SharePoint: Sections with Copilot
items.description:
Sections with Copilot is a new SharePoint authoring tool that allows users to create full-fidelity SharePoint sections with just a prompt. It works by first looking at the context of your page to offer prompt suggestions for what content you need next to offer a starting point. Next, you either select one of those starting points or write your own and optionally ground in a relevant file.
 
Once you click generate, Sections with Copilot then leverages the knowledge and content already inside of your organization and on your page to create rich sections that go beyond just image and text. This could mean meeting transcripts, recent documents, or any other knowledge Copilot has access to, added to an existing page with a click of a button. 
 
If the output section isn't quite right, you can then use AI refinement to make changes to both the content and layout of your section, without ever touching our traditional authoring tools. Some examples include "change the background image", "add John Smith's contact information", or "make the text more professional". You can also get different suggestions by clicking "regenerate" and then choosing your favorite one to refine further. With Sections with Copilot, you can create content faster than ever before, no matter your SharePoint skill level.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Copilot Enhancements for smarter authoring
items.description: We’ve made some exciting updates to Viva Amplify's authoring experience that will take your content creation experience to the next level. With our latest release, Copilot is now smarter and more helpful than ever, leveraging your files, like Word documents, and even meeting content, to generate high-quality communications with ease. Here’s what’s new: 1. Smarter prompt tuning We’ve fine-tuned how drafts and rewrites are handled, resulting in clearer, better-formatted output that aligns with your tone and goals. 2. Create content from files and meetings You can now use Word and Excel files, or even meeting recordings, as inputs to help generate content. Whether you're working from a doc, a spreadsheet, or a conversation, Copilot in Amplify helps you turn ideas into polished messaging. 3. Unified content generation flow We’ve migrated to a common service that brings a consistent and scalable experience across all your AI tools in SharePoint and Viva Amplify. What's more, generated content now appears in real-time, making the experience smoother and faster. These updates are part of our continued investment in delivering an intelligent, seamless authoring experience.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: New VDI solution for Teams optimization in Amazon WorkSpaces
items.description:
New VDI solution for Teams introduces multimedia offloading and optimization solution for Microsoft Teams when running in Amazon WorkSpaces (Personal and Pools).
Users of the WorkSpaces Client for Windows can enjoy a high-definition experience in virtual desktops, where audio/video/screensharing are offloaded to the user's device and processed by the SlimCore media engine.
This entry applies to WorkSpaces only (AppStream is not supported).

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Summarize email with Copilot chat in Outlook
items.description: Users without a Microsoft 365 Copilot license can now easily summarize emails in a single click, using Copilot chat. Users must have access to Copilot chat and pinning enabled to utilize. This change is coming to both Classic and New Outlook for Windows #newoutlookforwindows

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Unified Conversations (Chat History) List
items.description: We’re making it easier to find what you need. This change will mean that users now see a single, streamlined list of all your conversations. No more switching between tabs or wondering where to look for specific conversations. Just select a conversation and you'll pick up in the same context and mode as where you left off.

items.title: Outlook: External tag in profile cards
items.description: For users that are external to your organization, an "External" tag will be shown in the top part of their profile card.

items.title: Microsoft 365 app: Microsoft Places Support to GCCH and DoD
items.description: "Microsoft Places is an AI-powered workplace app for flexible work. Places helps organizations reimagine flexible work with AI, enables employees to connect more easily in person so that they can make the most of in-office days.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: View and moderate private community content without being a member
items.description: This feature enables verified admins and Engage admins to access and moderate private community conversations without needing to be members of those communities. Admins will also be able to manage community settings, ensuring better governance and oversight across Viva Engage.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Custom font and theme support for Viva Amplify
items.description: Viva Amplify now supports custom themes and fonts published to Brand Center, empowering communicators to align their campaigns with brand identity and visual consistency across channels like Outlook and SharePoint.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Deploy Teams frontline worker pilot in Teams Admin Center
items.description: Deploy a frontline worker (FLW) pilot in Teams Admin Center

items.title: Microsoft 365 admin center: Usage reports - Copilot Chat - Usage intensity and new app coverage
items.description: The Copilot Chat usage report will include metrics on prompts submitted and expanded coverage across new host applications. Admins will now see total and average prompt counts at both tenant and user levels, along with user activity insights such as active days and last activity dates. Additionally, the report introduces visibility into Copilot Chat usage within Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and OneNote—enabling better tracking of adoption and engagement across these core Microsoft 365 apps. All metrics focus on unlicensed users and support export functionality for further analysis. User-level information is anonymized by default. #copilotcontrolsystem

items.title: Microsoft 365: SMTP onboarding to App Role Based Access Control
items.description: We're simplifying how organizations grant applications permission to send email on behalf of mailboxes. Today, customers must manually assign permissions to each individual mailbox using PowerShell, which is time-consuming and inefficient. With this new capability, admins can assign the SMTP.SendAsApp role to an app through App Role-Based Access Control (RBAC), enabling group-based or scoped access to mailboxes. This eliminates the need for per-mailbox configuration and streamlines onboarding for SMTP clients using OAuth. It’s a scalable, secure, and modern approach to managing mailbox access for applications.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Unread News Notifications in Connections
items.description: After further review, this has been delayed to a later date. We apologize for any inconvenience. Users will receive a weekly notification in the Connections apps in Microsoft Teams on mobile and desktop linking them to relevant SharePoint news that they might have missed in the preceding week. This unread news will be available in the "News" tab in the Connections app under the "unread" pill.

items.title: Outlook: Immersive Search
items.description: After completing a search in Outlook, a user will see a Copilot entry point that will take them to an LLM generated summary of their search query (emails, Teams messages and documents) within their Copilot side pane. They will be able to interact further with Copilot to dig deeper into these results and take action items accordingly.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: News AI audio briefing in Connections Mobile
items.description: This feature provides an AI generated audio overview of top 10 news items in the Viva Connections news reader experience. It plays the 10 audio clips sequentially to help users catch up on top news in a hands-free manner. This experience will be available in the Viva Connections App in Teams mobile on iOS and android.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Easier access to Researcher in Microsoft Word
items.description: The Researcher agent now has easier entry points on the Word canvas —making it faster to go from idea to polished research report without breaking your flow.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Easier access to Researcher in Microsoft Word
items.description: The Researcher agent now has easier entry points on the Word canvas —making it faster to go from idea to polished research report without breaking your flow.

items.title: SharePoint: Signed Adobe & Docusign documents saved to the originating folder
items.description: Documents signed via Adobe or DocuSign eSignature, when initiated through the SharePoint eSignature platform, will now be saved in the originating SharePoint folder instead of the default Apps folder. The originating folder is the folder where the starting document was  located at the point of eSignature request initiation.

items.title: Microsoft 365 Admin Center: Setting to pin M365 Copilot app to Windows taskbar
items.description: This feature allows Global and Intune administrators to pin the M365 Copilot app to the Windows taskbar, providing users with easy access to M365 Copilot capabilities like Chat, Search, Agents, Notebooks and Create. This setting applies to all Intune-managed Windows 10 and 11 devices with the app installed. #copilotcontrolsystem

items.title: Microsoft Entra: Improved Backup and Restore Experience for the Authenticator App on iOS
items.description: Users of the Microsoft Authenticator app on iOS will be able to back up account names—including Microsoft work or school accounts, Microsoft personal accounts, and third-party accounts like Amazon or Google—using iCloud and iCloud Keychain. This enables secure, end-to-end encrypted backup of account names and TOTP credentials. When setting up a new iOS device, account names will automatically appear in the app, and users can sign in to complete setup.

items.title: Outlook: Account Manager
items.description: Users can use the new Account Manager feature to learn more about their Microsoft account, display their profile picture, and add new accounts (if permitted by their organization).

items.title: SharePoint: Text Editor Copilot 'Refine' update
items.description: SharePoint is updating the capabilities of its text editor Copilot. Now, you can not only use copilot to rewrite your existing text but also use it to keep writing or add a grounding document. By answering the question "what do you want copilot to change", you can perform any number of refinements to your existing content.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: eDiscovery – Export download with pre-authorized link support
items.description: This update enhances the export download experience in Microsoft Purview eDiscovery by introducing support for both pre-authorized and non pre-authorized links. Pre-authorized links offer faster downloads and maintain session continuity for a specified duration. Non pre-authorized links require re-authentication after each connection loss and are needed for restricted environments that allow access only to limited Microsoft 365 IP ranges.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Recent activity is part of Copilot's dynamic document snapshot in Word
items.description: Select the Activity tab within the Copilot summary at the top of a document for a summary of recent comments and changes. Choose a time window of 3 days, 1 week, or 2 weeks.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Recent activity is part of Copilot's dynamic document snapshot in Word
items.description: Select the Activity tab within the Copilot summary at the top of a document for a summary of recent comments and changes. Choose a time window of 3 days, 1 week, or 2 weeks.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Say "Hey Copilot" to activate voice conversations with the Microsoft 365 Copilot app on Windows
items.description: With the Microsoft 365 Copilot app on Windows, say “Hey Copilot” to activate real-time voice conversations with Copilot. The wake word keeps you in flow, helping you draft content, analyze data, and get critical insights without having to navigate to a separate app or window. Built for enterprise, it respects your organization’s compliance and privacy settings, activating only when called.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Edit and manage Teams Town Hall instances in Outlook
items.description: Organizers and co-organizers can now easily edit the details of Teams Town Hall instances. A direct link to the Teams Town Hall edit page is now accessible from Outlook calendar. This enhancement brings the same seamless editing and registration management experience already available in webinar, bringing a consistent experience across all event types.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot Chat now supports more file types in search grounding.
items.description: We are expanding the file types supported in Copilot Chat to align with the Microsoft Search experience.

items.title: Microsoft Purview Compliance Portal: Service health dashboard
items.description: As a Microsoft Purview user, you'll be able to view outages, service issues, and advisories that might impact your services. This new dashboard will combine the services and solutions health of Purview, Microsoft 365 services, and Azure Cloud Services in one central place in the Purview portal, eliminating the need to go to several places to find this information.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat for EDU customers ages 13 and older
items.description: Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat is available at no additional cost for Microsoft 365 EDU users ages 13 and older who sign in with their Microsoft Entra account (no Microsoft 365 Copilot license required). Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat offers enterprise data protection (EDP), and secure AI chat, powered by the latest large language models with optional web grounding. Admins must take action to enable access.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Optical character recognition (OCR) - Support for embedded images in files including Office files in SharePoint and OneDrive
items.description: Optical character recognition (OCR) scanning enables Microsoft Purview to scan images for sensitive information. With Embedded support, OCR will scan content in DOCX, PPTX, XLSX and PDFs (scanned and hybrid containing searchable text and images). This will be in addition to support for standalone images

items.title: Microsoft 365 admin center: Agents usage report
items.description: A new agents usage report will be available in the Microsoft 365 admin center. The report will be scoped to include agents in M365 Copilot and Copilot Chat with usage by both M365 Copilot licensed and unlicensed users. The report will include total active agent users, total active agents, active users segmentation by licensed and unlicensed users, and active users and active agents segmentation by publisher type (i.e. user-created agents, agents built by your org, agents built by Microsoft, agents built by Microsoft partners). The report will also include usage details per user, agent, and user-agent pair. #copilotcontrolsystem

items.title: Microsoft CoPilot (Microsoft 365): List email attachments in M365 Copilot
items.description: Users will be able to list the file attachments that they received or sent over email in M365 Copilot.

items.title: Outlook: Play a Sound Rule
