items.title: SharePoint: New File Format Support for Document Translation
items.description: We're expanding file format support for Content AI Document Translation in SharePoint Online. Newly added extensions include: xlf, tsv, tab, mdown, mdtext, mdtxt, mdwn, mht, mhtml, mkd, mkdn, odt, rmd. This update brings us in alignment with Azure Document Translation capabilities and unlocks new scenarios, such as .xlf support, which enables seamless translation of eLearning and localization content exported from many industry tools.

items.title: Outlook: Updating Conversation Actions on Outlook for iOS
items.description: Currently, when viewing a message, you can access the available actions in the top-right corner. We are updating these actions to be at the bottom of the screen with the ability to customize the order and placement of the actions to suit your needs.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: New configuration option in Collection Policies for targeted detection of Enterprise AI app interactions
items.description: This category will empower admins to precisely control and optimize the signals and data collected across enterprise AI apps in Purview solutions, enable better compliance with local regulations, reduce noise from SITs and user activities that aren’t relevant to your organization to improve resource efficiency, and control ingestion of prompts and responses. These apps include ChatGPT Enterprise, apps built on Azure AI service, and Microsoft Entra-connected AI apps.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Access audio overviews from the top of your Word document
items.description: Ask Copilot to generate an audio overview of your document from the Summary tab in the document snapshot. We have updated the status to accurately reflect the current state of the feature.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Create a presentation with Copilot from the PowerPoint backstage view
items.description: You can now create a presentation with Copilot straight from the PowerPoint backstage view, accessible when you start PowerPoint or when you select the File tab.

items.title: Outlook: Offline Support for Calendar - Create, Edit and Delete Event support
items.description: We are adding more offline functionality in the new Outlook for Windows. You will now be able to create, edit, and delete events in your calendar when not connected to the internet. #newoutlookforwindows

items.title: Exchange: Exchange Online Moderation approval requests via Actionable Messages
items.description: The Exchange Online Moderation feature gives message moderators the ability to Approve or Reject sending a moderated message to its intended recipients via a special email message form that includes Approve and Reject buttons in the Outlook Desktop or Outlook on the web toolbar. However, the ability to approve or reject a moderated message currently isn't supported on Outlook for iOS, Outlook for Android, or Outlook for Mac. With this update to use Actionable Messages for moderation approval messages, moderators with mailboxes hosted in Exchange Online will now be able to approve or reject moderated messages via all the Microsoft email clients: from Outlook for Windows, Outlook for Mac, Outlook for iOS and Outlook for Android.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Information Protection - Confidence level filtering in Content Explorer Cmdlet
items.description: With this feature, we will be providing confidence information in content explorer cmdlet export along with the capability to filter results on the basis of confidence level

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Reference up to 5 files when creating a presentation with Copilot for PowerPoint
items.description: You can now reference up to 5 files when creating a presentation with Copilot.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Reference up to 5 files when creating a presentation with Copilot for PowerPoint
items.description: You can now reference up to 5 files when creating a presentation with Copilot.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Reference up to 5 files when creating a presentation with Copilot for PowerPoint
items.description: You can now reference up to 5 files when creating a presentation with Copilot.

items.title: Microsoft Teams:  Interactive Agents for Teams Meetings and Calls
items.description: After further review, we are not able to continue rolling this out at this time.  We apologize for any inconvenience. Introducing a new feature that brings interactive agents into your Teams meetings and 1-on-1 calls. Engage with agents as a group or privately, with zero state prompts and history support for seamless interactions. Currently, only agents built on Copilot support sessions, meaning they can remember the context of previous interactions within the same session for more relevant responses. Custom agents do not yet have session support. All agents from BizChat/Copilot Studio are now available for use in your meetings and calls. This feature allows secure testing and iteration, inviting colleagues for feedback without affecting sensitive data or production channels.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Intelligent meeting recap can summarize content shared on screen
items.description: Intelligent meeting recap can incorporate content shared on screen in the AI-based summary provided after the meeting, providing a richer and more comprehensive recap of the meeting.  It captures details that are shown when a participant shares their screen, ensuring those unspoken insights become part of the meeting recap.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Enhanced Meeting Protection - Prevent Screen Capture
items.description: To address the issue of unauthorized screen captures during meetings, the Prevent Screen Capture feature ensures that if a user attempts to take a screen capture, the meeting window will turn black, thereby protecting sensitive information. This feature will be available on Teams desktop applications (both Windows and Mac) and Teams mobile applications (both iOS and Android). For users joining from unsupported platforms, they will be placed in audio-only mode to maintain the integrity of the meeting's content.

items.title: Microsoft Purview Compliance Portal: Information Protection - Sensitivity Label support in Engage
items.description: Your organization can now manually apply Information Protection sensitivity labels in Engage. Sensitivity label support in this new application will allow admins to create labels and configure label publishing policies to determine which users and groups can manually label content in Engage. End users will be able to manually apply labels to Engage communities and in turn classify and protect their sensitive data via privacy and external user access controls.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Set New Ringtones in Teams Mobile
items.description: This feature allows you to customize and select different sounds for various types of calls, helping you better manage your alerts and distinguish between different incoming communications. For users with Microsoft Teams Phone, this also includes calls for forwarded and delegated calls.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Glint -User Schema Enhancements: Self-Serve Renaming for Custom Hierarchies
items.description: This feature enables Viva Glint admins to rename existing hierarchies and hierarchy levels within the user schema. By providing a self-service capability, admins can easily manage and update the structure of user data without requiring external support.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Glint and Viva Insights Integration - Workplace Patterns Report in Viva Glint
items.description: An intuitive report that highlights the relationships between employee sentiment items and the workplace patterns and drivers that shape engagement. This feature eliminates the need for custom analysis, enabling users to share out of the box actionable insights with leaders—accelerating decision-making to drive meaningful actions across the organization

items.title: Microsoft Edge: Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat Summarization in Edge for Business Context Menu
items.description: Microsoft Edge for Business plans to introduce a Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat summarization menu item to our context menu. This feature will help users quickly unpack and ask questions about their open page.

items.title: Outlook: Unverified Senders- warn users about spoofing and impersonation attempts
items.description: When you receive messages from senders we weren't able to verify as safe, you'll see a tag in the message list and a ribbon on the reading pane warning you to be cautious when interacting with it.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Remote log collection in Teams admin center​
items.description: Teams Administrators will have the ability to remotely collect client diagnostics logs for troubleshooting from users' devices, aiming to minimize or eliminate the need for user intervention and workflow disruption previously required for collecting diagnostics logs.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Information Protection - Email Attachment Preview in Content Explorer
items.description: This feature allows admins to view the attachments of an email within purview content explorer. This will help admins with their investigation process

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Call Waiting Beep Enabled on Desktop
items.description: Call Waiting Beep is a feature designed to provide a subtle notification tone when a user is already on a call and a second call comes in. This gentle alert ensures the user is aware of the incoming call without being overly disruptive.

items.title: Microsoft Intune: Customization of app installs with Enterprise Application Management
items.description: Script installer offers you a way to have more control and customization around Win32 (including in EAM catalog) app installations. You now have the option to use a PowerShell script in place of command line configurations to install your app.

items.title: Microsoft Intune: Intune Suite - Operational dashboard to gain insight on EPM status and elevations.
items.description: The dashboard focuses EPM insights on rollout status as well as elevations in the environment and suggestions for new rules to create.

items.title: Microsoft Intune: Intune Suite - Websocket Support for Tunnel MAM (iOS)
items.description: WebSocket support for Tunnel enables secure, real-time communication for apps using WebSockets. It supports JavaScript WebSockets through web views but doesn't fully support iOS native APIs like NSWebSocket.

items.title: SharePoint: Optical Character Recognition (OCR) Backfill for SharePoint Sites
items.description:
We are thrilled to announce a powerful new feature that allows tenant admins to select an existing SharePoint Online (SPO) site and backfill OCR for documents already present in the library. This means you no longer need to move all your documents to a new site to ensure they are OCRed and protected.

We plan to release a private preview at end of May, if you would like to enable this feature please reach out the feature team and we will enable the feature on your tenant.

Only files without OCR will be processed, ensuring efficient use of resources and preventing double charges for unchanged documents. This update streamlines your workflow, making it easier to manage and protect your documents.

items.title: Microsoft Purview Compliance Portal: DLP Policy Tip Support in Outlook Mobile
items.description: DLP policy tip support for Outlook Mobile enhances data loss prevention measures on mobile devices by providing real-time alerts to help users avoid accidentally sharing sensitive information, ensuring compliance with organizational policies.

items.title: Microsoft Purview Compliance Portal: Enable policy tips for recipients when emailed as part of a distribution group
items.description: This feature enables policy tips for recipients when emailed as part of a group. DG expansion refers to the process of expanding Distribution Groups (DG) to ensure all recipients are evaluated for Data Loss Prevention (DLP) rules. This feature allows organizations to evaluate rules based on recipients contained in distribution groups, increasing the confidence that users will receive relevant warnings while drafting emails with sensitive content.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Loss Prevention - Enable policy tips for recipients when emailed as part of a distribution group
items.description: This feature enables policy tips for recipients when emailed as part of a group. DG expansion refers to the process of expanding Distribution Groups (DG) to ensure all recipients are evaluated for Data Loss Prevention (DLP) rules. This feature allows organizations to evaluate rules based on recipients contained in distribution groups, increasing the confidence that users will receive relevant warnings while drafting emails with sensitive content.

items.title: Microsoft Purview Compliance Portal: Endpoint Data Loss Prevention - Device and Device group-based policy scoping support for Endpoint DLP
items.description: Currently you can create Purview Endpoint DLP policy and assign to specific users or user groups. This feature will allow you to create and release feature based on both users and machines. You can use this feature to achieve different policies for same user on different devices.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Teams Meeting Audit Events in GCC
items.description: Teams Audit Events for Meetings, including MeetingDetail and MeetingParticipantDetail, will soon be available in GCC. This enhancement will provide administrators with comprehensive insights into meeting activities, helping to ensure compliance and improve operational efficiency. MeetingDetail: Captures detailed information about meetings, including start and end times, meeting subject, and organizer details. MeetingParticipantDetail: Logs participant information, including join and leave times, participant roles, and any changes in participant status during the meeting. Audit logs are accessible through the Microsoft Purview portal, where administrators can search, filter, and export audit data for detailed analysis. These logs are essential for maintaining compliance, investigating incidents, and ensuring the security of Teams activities.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Interpreter agent available in Teams
items.description: The Interpreter agent enables real-time interpretation in Teams meetings in up to nine languages so each participant can speak and listen in the language of their choice. Meeting participants can also opt-in to have Interpreter simulate their personal voice for a more inclusive experience.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: External group chat policy enforcements for max two orgs
items.description: Facilitate creation and maintenance of external group chats with bilateral policy enforcement where members in the chat can belong to a maximum of two tenants.  Allow tenant admins to control bilateral chat policy and apply it to users and groups.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Silent test call
items.description: Silent Test enables IT administrators to proactively run synthetic Teams call simulations to specific subnets, helping assess network readiness and detect potential issues before they impact users, ensuring a seamless communication experience.

items.title: SharePoint: Time to read on SharePoint News posts
items.description: Each news item in SharePoint will display estimated read time of the article.

items.title: OneDrive: Prompt for permitted users to sign in to OneDrive app with personal Microsoft account
items.description: Users have long been able to use personal Microsoft accounts with the OneDrive app on corporate Windows devices—unless restricted by admin policy. This new feature introduces a prompt only when a personal account is already signed in on the device, encouraging users to also sign in to the OneDrive app with that account. Administrators who have already restricted personal accounts on corporate devices can continue to manage this as before. Organizations that have already disabled personal OneDrive accounts on corporate devices with the DisablePersonalSync policy will not see this prompt. Administrators can also suppress it using the DisableNewAccountDetection policy. More information on configuring policies can be found here:

items.title: Microsoft Purview Compliance Portal: Custom CC policy as IRM indicator
items.description:
IRM admins can now select any Communication Compliance (CC) Policy alerts as indicators in IRM policies. After this rollout, IRM admins can select any custom CC policies that they would like to bring into IRM and detect if a user has alerts for these CC policies. When an IRM alert is generated, admins can review if there are any alerts for the user within CC under the policies that are enabled as indicators. This feature will help admins and analysts view this information in IRM without switching to CC.

 

Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, data leakage, and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies to manage security and compliance. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Modernized Viva Engage Email Subscription Management
items.description: We will modernize the existing email subscription management experience in Viva Engage to make it more user-friendly and intuitive. Previously, unsubscribe and notification settings links in emails opened legacy web pages with limited functionality. After this update, those links will direct users to refreshed, modern pages where they can easily manage their email preferences. Users will be able to unsubscribe or resubscribe to specific email types in a cleaner and more accessible experience.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: New audit logs for Give control, Take control, and Screensharing
items.description: IT administrators will now have the ability to access detailed logs for both the "Give and Take Control" and "Screenshare" features. These logs will provide comprehensive information, including the names and timestamps of the individuals involved in each action. Specifically, the logs will indicate who initiated or received control, as well as who started the screenshare session, along with the corresponding timestamps and names. This enhancement ensures greater transparency and accountability for all control and screenshare activities. Accessible in Teams Admin Centre.

items.title: Microsoft Purview Compliance Portal: DLP Policy Tip Support in Outlook Mobile
items.description: DLP policy tip support for Outlook Mobile enhances data loss prevention measures on mobile devices by providing real-time alerts to help users avoid accidentally sharing sensitive information, ensuring compliance with organizational policies.

items.title: Microsoft Purview Compliance Portal: Dynamic watermarking for files protected with sensitivity labels
items.description: Dynamic watermarking is a sensitivity label setting that overlays watermark text containing the consuming user’s information on content in Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.

items.title: SharePoint: Create multi-color themes for SharePoint in brand center
items.description: We're bringing a new theme creation experience into brand center that supports multiple colors, allowing you to easily create and manage multi-color themes for your sites and related experiences.

items.title: Microsoft 365 app: Microsoft Places - Configure auto-release for desks
items.description: Admins can now configure desks so that users must check-in (within a configurable duration after desk reservation start time); if users do not check-in to the desk, the desk will auto-release and be made available for others to book. #MicrosoftPlaces

items.title: Microsoft 365: Microsoft Places - Enhanced desk booking capabilities
items.description: Microsoft 365 now offers the ability to book desks for durations smaller than whole day, book for multiple days at the same time, and delegates/EAs can book desks for their principals. #MicrosoftPlaces

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Microsoft 365 Copilot Search
items.description: Simple to use AI-powered enterprise search experience that quickly surfaces relevant information using work data you have access to.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Updates to Copilot Chat response output
items.description: Easily interact with Microsoft Graph content represented by bolder references, new action bar, and more.

items.title: Microsoft 365 app: Use Copilot in PDFs within the Microsoft 365 Copilot mobile app
items.description: Use Copilot with PDF files for summaries and key insights.

items.title: Planner: New Microsoft Planner app for Microsoft Teams in GCC High
items.description: After further review, we will not be rolling this out to DoD. We apologize for any inconvenience. The new Microsoft Planner app in Teams is a single, unified work management experience. It brings together the simplicity of To Do, the collaboration of Planner into a single and simple solution, that offers individual task management, collaborative work management as well as enterprise work management.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Configurable Keyboard Shortcuts
items.description: Set your own keyboard shortcuts to match your work preferences. Customize the keyboard shortcut for an action you frequently use by clicking on the ellipsis and selecting Keyboard shortcuts from the menu.

items.title: Microsoft 365: Use Copilot in your search tab in the Microsoft 365 Copilot mobile app
items.description: Quickly find your files and leverage Copilot to get a better understanding within the search tab on the go.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Receive coaching on your writing in Copilot in Word
items.description: The Copilot context menu will include an option for getting AI-generated coaching. Copilot will review the writing and offer suggestions for high-impact areas, such as logical structure, flow, and tone.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Receive coaching on your writing in Copilot in Word
items.description: The Copilot context menu will include an option for getting AI-generated coaching. Copilot will review the writing and offer suggestions for high-impact areas, such as logical structure, flow, and tone.

items.title: Microsoft 365 app: Copilot Notebooks Module
items.description: Copilot Notebooks Module in the M365 Copilot App

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): The Create Module in the M365 Copilot app
items.description: The creative hub for AI led artifact generation capabilities

items.title: Microsoft 365 Admin Center: Usage reports - Message consumption for Pay-as-you-go experiences in Copilot Chat.
items.description: A new report to help IT admins manage costs for billed messages that are Pay-as-you-go enabled for Copilot Chat. Reporting includes drill down of billed messages per user, per billing policy, per agent-level and agent-user level pair. #copilotcontrolsystem

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): OneNote Pages in M365 Copilot
items.description: M365 Copilot experiences can now reason over your OneNote content

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Open Copilot Pages as a Word document
items.description: Once a Copilot Chat user has finished researching, creating, and collecting content in Copilot Pages, they can take it to a Word document with the press of a button.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Simplified Input box update in Copilot Chat
items.description: We are making it easier for users to type prompts with access to CIQ, local files, attach cloud files, and agents by adding it under the Plus Menu.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Updated UI for Microsoft 365 Copilot App
items.description: The Microsoft 365 Copilot app is your starting place for AI at work, offering quick access to secure AI chat, search, files, and content creation in one seamless app.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Copilot in Teams can generate an audio overview of your meetings
items.description: Copilot can generate an audio overview of your transcribed meetings, transforming one or multiple meetings into an engaging listening experience. Users can choose how they want to listen: select one or two speakers, adjust the tone from concise to playful, and tailor the length. This capability is only available in English currently.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: AI assistant for admins in the Pro Management portal
items.description: IT admins can optimize their time and resources by utilizing the Pro Management Portal AI assistant. It offers comprehensive answers to questions about Teams meeting spaces and management solutions and delivers data and insights specific to inventory in the organization’s environment. This feature is available with Teams Rooms Pro and does not require a Microsoft 365 Copilot license.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Microsoft Purview Data Security Posture Management for AI Apps and agents
items.description: Apps and agents in Microsoft Purview Data Security Posture Management for AI apps enables administrators to view a dashboard of agents used across the organization and identify and manage any potential data security risks. Administrators can access detailed insights into sensitive data that specific agents have accessed and see how these agents are protected by Purview data security policies. The detailed agent view also indicates what policies are applied to the agent and provides the option for administrators to create a policy directly from this view to address any coverage gaps. #copilotcontrolsystem

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Microsoft 365 Copilot App - Ask M365 Copilot
items.description: Right-click on your content to ask Copilot about it on Copilot PC devices.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot surfaces key statistics in the top of a document
items.description: Copilot includes a summary at the top of key statistics from your Word document.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot can generate an audio overview of a notebook
items.description: Copilot can turn the referenced files in a notebook into a dynamic audio overview, transforming them into a listening experience that’s easy to follow. To generate an audio overview in Copilot Notebooks, select ‘Generate audio overview’ at the top of the notebook. This capability is only available in English currently.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot Pages module on Microsoft 365 Copilot mobile app
items.description: With the Copilot Pages module in the Microsoft 365 Copilot app on your mobile, you can now access all of your Pages in one place on the go.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365):  Copilot Memory
items.description: Microsoft 365 Copilot leverages insights inferred from conversations between the user and Copilot, along with data from the Microsoft Graph and custom instructions to provide personalized help for tasks. Users have full control and can view, manage, disable or clear memory at any time.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Enhanced contextual discovery of agents within Microsoft 365
items.description: Customers now have new experience to discover, install, and use/reuse agents within the Copilot app for Microsoft 365.

items.title: Microsoft Purview Information Protection: Doc library default labeling for SharePoint Online and Copilot
items.description: This new capability further integrates SharePoint Online with Purview sensitivity labeling. SharePoint Online document library owners can set a new type of default label on the library, which automatically applies that label to all unprotected Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and PDF files within the library. This simplifies labeling in bulk across document libraries in an organization, enriches DLP and Copilot with signal to allow admins to monitor and restrict access to this content, and enables inheritance of sensitivity labels to output artifacts in Copilot. #copilotcontrolsystem

items.title: Microsoft Purview Information Protection: Doc library default labeling for SharePoint Online and Copilot
items.description: This new capability further integrates SharePoint Online with Purview sensitivity labeling. SharePoint Online document library owners can set a new type of default label on the library, which automatically applies that label to all unprotected Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and PDF files within the library. This simplifies labeling in bulk across document libraries in an organization, enriches DLP and Copilot with signal to allow admins to monitor and restrict access to this content, and enables inheritance of sensitivity labels to output artifacts in Copilot. #copilotcontrolsystem

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Locate your Copilot Pages in Copilot Chat navigation pane
items.description: For quick access to your Copilot Pages, find all page artifacts created across your apps/modules in one place underneath the Chat section in the Microsoft 365 Copilot app.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): People Skills is now available
items.description: We’re excited to launch People Skills, an AI-powered service that delivers personalized skills-based experiences across Microsoft 365. Using advanced inferencing, it helps organizations identify skill gaps and promote upskilling. With People Skills, individuals can easily share a current view of their skills and more easily connect with others. People Skills data enriches people-based experiences in Microsoft 365 Copilot and in the Microsoft 365 profile card and editor.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot Chat module UI refresh
items.description: Copilot Chat is designed to provide a streamlined UI, making it easy to get started and achieve your goals quickly. It offers a helpful, understanding, and personalized experience, allowing you to search for past interactions, content, agents, or pages with ease.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot Pages in Government Clouds
items.description: This brings the editable Copilot Pages feature which is already shipped WW to the government environment. The pages feature enables users to add their Microsoft 365 Copilot responses to a page where they can edit and share with others for collaboration. This happens right within the Microsoft 365 Copilot app.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): [Copilot Extensibility] Discover agent in Microsoft Copilot on iOS/Android
items.description: Agent has been released to Desktop/Web Copilot and now we are enabling Agent UX in mobile endpoints. It will allow end-users to discover installed agents, add new agents and chat with them in mobile Copilot on Teams, Outlook and Microsoft 365 Copilot App (formerly Microsoft 365 App).

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Quickly start a chat with Copilot from anywhere on your PC
items.description: Use the Copilot key and Win + C shortcut on Windows 11 devices to quickly interact with Copilot.

items.title: SharePoint: Modern SharePoint Page Templates
items.description: The Modern SharePoint Page Templates feature introduces a new Template Gallery, providing users with a centralized hub to discover, preview, and select from over 50 modern out-of-the-box (OOB) templates and custom templates. This feature empowers users to create high-quality, on-brand pages effortlessly, enhancing productivity while ensuring consistency and visual appeal across SharePoint sites. Key highlights: Template Gallery: Centralized hub to access both Saved on this site (custom templates) and From Microsoft (OOB templates). 50+ new OOB templates: A collection of aesthetically pleasing, professional, and easy-to-use templates that empower users to quickly create visually engaging and consistent content for common use cases like status updates, event announcements, and team introductions.

items.title: SharePoint: Customize your sites with multi-color themes
items.description: Site owners can now apply multi-color themes to their sites. These themes can be offered by Microsoft, created by the brand manager in the brand center, or by the site owners themselves using the new Site branding feature.

items.title: Planner: New Microsoft Planner App for Teams for customers in GCC-H
items.description: The new Microsoft Planner app in Teams is a single, unified work management experience. It brings together the simplicity of To Do, the collaboration of Planner and the power of Project into a single and simple solution that offers individual task management, collaborative work management as well as enterprise work management.

items.title: Outlook: Account Switcher for Copilot Tab
items.description: You can now switch between accounts on the Copilot tab. Simply swipe left to open the the left-navigation and select from the list of supported accounts.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Sharing with Copilot summary - Now supporting PowerPoint, Excel, PDFs, Images, and protected files
items.description: The ability to include a Copilot summary when sharing a file now extends beyond Word web to cover PowerPoint (web), Excel (web), PDF, image and text files in OneDrive Web, SharePoint document libraries, and M365 File Viewer. You can even summarize protected or confidential files, preserving your sensitivity labels while getting instant overviews. These enhancements broaden your sharing toolkit, accelerate collaboration and keep your data secure.

items.title: SharePoint: Header & Footer Enhancements
items.description: The site header and footer are key elements of the SharePoint user interface, playing a vital role in navigation, brand expression, and overall user experience. To better align with today’s design standards and customer expectations, we’re introducing a full visual upgrade of the SharePoint site header and footer. This upgrade delivers a more cohesive and contemporary look while offering new preset layouts and enhanced customization options. Organizations will be able to tailor these elements to better reflect their brand identity, improve usability, and create a more engaging, connected experience for employees.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot can now answer questions about opened Copilot Pages in chat
items.description: When using Copilot Pages side-by-side in Copilot Chat, you can now ask questions in chat about your open page, and Copilot will provide answers based on the contents of that page.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: New Microsoft Teams Chat and channels experience in Education
items.description: The new, streamlined chat and channels experience makes it easier to stay on top of what matters most and organize your digital workspace. Catch up on chat, channels and teams in one place, create custom sections to organize conversations by topics, use filters to triage messages and more. This is an optional opt-in experience.

items.title: Microsoft Purview Compliance Portal: Timeline view of user activity
items.description: This feature offers a comprehensive timeline view of a user's potentially risky interactions that may result in a data security or compliance incident. It includes both interactions with other users and generative AI applications that have been flagged for review. This empowers reviewers by providing context on the user's history, enabling them to address violations with a complete view of all other potential risky interactions that may result in a data security or compliance incident. As a result, reviewers can make informed decisions, streamlining the review process to be both efficient and effective.

items.title: Microsoft Purview Compliance Portal: Microsoft Purview Data Security Posture Management for AI: Additional permissions for AI roles
items.description: New roles added to Microsoft Purview Data Security Posture Management for AI that are customized to accessing AI data. #copilotcontrolsystem

items.title: Microsoft Purview Compliance Portal: Microsoft Purview Data Security Posture Management for AI: Web Search Query
items.description: Within Microsoft Purview Data Security Posture Management for AI, AI interactions can be filtered to show interactions that contain a web search query and the contents of the web search query are shown. #copilotcontrolsystem

items.title: Microsoft 365 app: Microsoft Places - New options for desk mode configuration
items.description: Desks can now be configured for different modes, depending on the immediate needs of the Places administrator; configurations can be changed at any time. Available desk modes include: Offline (the desk cannot be booked by anyone, also default for individual desks); Assigned (individual desks can be assigned to specific users); Bookable (the desk can be booked, subject to availability/available capacity and configured policies; and Walk-up (the desk can only be booked in person and requires the user to be physically present at the desk, subject to availability/available capacity and configured policies). #MicrosoftPlaces

items.title: SharePoint: Copilot actions in SharePoint document libraries
items.description: When you select an item in OneDrive on the Web, the Copilot button appears, offering a range of actions you can perform on that item. The same feature and actions are coming to document library views in SharePoint and Teams.

items.title: SharePoint: OneDrive and SharePoint – Use table of contents in PDF
items.description: OneDrive for the web and SharePoint Online can display a table of contents if it’s already in your PDF. You can select the line item in the table of contents to jump directly to the location of that item in the page.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Drafting on a selection includes being able to reference files, emails, and meetings
items.description: Just like when you're using Copilot to draft content on a blank line in your document, you can reference resources that provide context in addition to the content you've selected in your document.

items.title: Outlook: Ability to copy attachments that are not links
items.description: When this rolls out, customers will be able to copy and paste attachments that are not links only in supported locations without having to save to device or cloud storage.

items.title: Outlook: Jump to a row in the Message List on Outlook on the Web and New Outlook for Windows
items.description: We're making it possible to jump to a row in the Message List by typing. For example, while sorted by "From", you'll be able to type "Philip" to jump to the first row where the sender is "Philip". #outlookforwindows

items.title: Microsoft Teams: New Voice Applications Settings for Authorized Users in GCC High and DoD (Premium)
items.description: Voice applications policies allow you to create and assign voice application policies to authorized users. Voice application policies control what configuration changes an authorized user can make to the auto attendants and call queues they're authorized for. Authorized users, with permissions from Teams admins, can configure their call queues and auto attendants using Teams settings and opt in or out their team members to optimize for business needs. This is a Teams Premium feature.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Glint - Export Team Summary report in Viva Glint to editable PowerPoint slides
items.description: Managers will be able to export default sections from the Team Summary report in Viva Glint directly to editable PowerPoint slides. This enhancement allows for easier and quicker consumption of this report outside Viva Glint, compared to the previous export method which included static screenshots.

items.title: Microsoft 365 app: Microsoft Places - Find and book desks near colleagues
items.description: The refreshed desk booking experience allows users to find where their colleagues are planning to sit on a map and book a desk nearby. Each user is in control and can decide whether to share their desk booking information with others. #MicrosoftPlaces

items.title: Microsoft 365 app: Microsoft Places - Book desks from maps
items.description: The refreshed desk booking experience supports desks configured individually or as part of a pool. It puts maps front and center, with support for fixtures, but continues to work without maps. The same experience will be accessible from the calendar (in New Outlook, Teams and OWA) and from the Places app (on the web, or as a Connected app in Teams and Outlook), and will adapt to mobile/small screens. #MicrosoftPlaces

items.title: Microsoft 365 app: Microsoft Places Management portal
items.description: Places Admins can use a user-friendly interface to manage their Places directory data such as create, view and edit buildings, floors, sections, rooms and desks. #MicrosoftPlaces

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Quickly launch the Microsoft 365 Copilot app on your iOS device
items.description: Press the Action button or ask Siri to launch Copilot on your iOS device.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Access SharePoint agents in the Microsoft 365 Copilot app
items.description: Use SharePoint agents seamlessly without navigating to the SharePoint site. With this new feature, you can quickly return to your most recently used SharePoint agents directly in the Microsoft 365 Copilot app.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Town halls in DoD
items.description: Set up and host large scale events across a DoD organization with the familiar Teams app you use for meetings using town hall. Town hall capabilities include a new meeting template, capacity for up to 20k attendees, green room, the ability to manage what attendees see, RTMP-in, live translated captions, and more.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Polls support in Teams Town hall [Premium]
items.description: Organizers can now create and share polls directly within Teams Town halls, gathering real-time feedback from participants through multiple-choice questions and other types of polls. This feature is available for town hall organizers that have an active Teams Premium license.

items.title: SharePoint: Office 365 CDN in SharePoint
items.description: Use Office 365 Content Delivery Network (CDN) to host static assets to provide better performance for your SharePoint Online pages.

items.title: Outlook: Find Text when reading email on Outlook on the Web and New Outlook for Windows
items.description: The ability to find text when reading email on Outlook will be supported. This feature will bear resemblance to F4 on Outlook for Windows, or Ctrl+F in another apps. #newoutlookforwindows

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot in Excel with Python for GCC
items.description: Copilot in Excel gains powerful new insights and visualizations with Advanced Analysis. Explore your data in a natural, conversational way, while Copilot does the heavy lifting using Python, a rich programming language that supercharges what is possible in your spreadsheets.

items.title: SharePoint: OneDrive and SharePoint -  Apply watermark to PDF
items.description: OneDrive for Web now lets you add text or images as watermarks to your PDF documents. You can place the watermark in front of your content and choose the perfect location and angle for it.

items.title: SharePoint: Document Libraries - A new forms experience for streamlined document collection
items.description: Introducing native forms within SharePoint Document Libraries to streamline document collection. Users can create custom forms directly in libraries for seamless file uploads and metadata submission. Forms can be shared as links within the organization, facilitating document collection without additional access. This integration enhances productivity by simplifying workflows and improving user experience.

items.title: Outlook: Create, Delete, Rename, and Move Folders
items.description: You will now be able to more easily create, delete, rename, and move folders on mobile. From your inbox, tap the Edit icon in the sidebar. Tap on any folder to create a subfolder, or rename, move, and delete that folder. You can also rearrange and nest your folders by dragging and dropping them.

items.title: Microsoft 365 app: Microsoft Places - Built in Admin role support
items.description: Microsoft Places will deliver built in admin roles to help delegate to day-to-day management of Places. #MicrosoftPlaces

items.title: Microsoft 365 app: Microsoft Places - Graph API support for directory objects
items.description: Microsoft Places will now support Graph API to allow CRUD (Create, read, update and delete) operations on Places directory objects. #MicrosoftPlaces

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Security Posture Management for AI: Department Graph
items.description: New graph added to Microsoft Purview Data Security Posture Management for AI displaying the departments of users interacting with AI apps.

items.title: Outlook: Shared with Me Settings page
items.description: New Settings page will give users details on the permissions they have for Shared folders and mailboxes they have added in the new Outlook for Windows and web.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Sessions Grouped by Time frame
items.description: This feature will provide users conversation history list structure through grouping conversations by time frame to make it easy for users to visually parse.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Create Copilot Pages from Copilot Chat on your mobile phone
items.description: Create Copilot Pages on your mobile phone to continue working on the go. Pages shared in Microsoft 365 are interactive and automatically synchronized for seamless collaboration.

items.title: Excel: Enable "View Side by Side" on Mac
items.description: You can now quickly compare worksheets in the same workbook or in different workbooks by viewing them side by side with synchronous scrolling and reset window positioning on Mac.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Fix all spelling and grammar issues with Copilot
items.description: One-click solution to fix spelling and grammar errors in the document

items.title: Microsoft Purview Compliance Portal: Endpoint DLP - Protect shadow files for OneDrive
items.description: Admins can protect OneDrive shadow files, that are not locally synced on an endpoint device. This feature has a dependency on Just-in-time (JIT) to provide the interim protection.

items.title: Microsoft Purview Compliance Portal: Data Security Posture Management for AI - M365 Copilot view
items.description: Within Microsoft Purview Data Security Posture Management for AI, a specific page is dedicated to showing protection capabilities and usage for M365 Copilot. #copilotcontrolsystem

items.title: Microsoft Edge: v.144 - Contextual nudges on address bar offering help summarizing webpages.
items.description: Microsoft Edge for Business plans to introduce an easy way for users to get summaries of their open page from the address bar using Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat. This feature seeks to help users more easily understand relevant content and save time.

items.title: Microsoft Purview: Data Loss Prevention OCR Cost Estimator Support for MAC Endpoints
items.description: OCR Cost Estimator allows you to estimate the potential cost for using Optical Character Recognition. This means that you will no longer be required to set up an Azure Subscription for billing first and can accurately estimate the cost you would have incurred while using OCR. This will help you to identify the optimal configuration settings for OCR as per your requirements. Cost Estimator can be used for 30 days and will not scan images for sensitive content.

items.title: SharePoint: Improved processing status experience for Content AI models in SharePoint Online
items.description: We’re introducing a new activity pane in SharePoint Online to help users track and troubleshoot Content AI model processing. Starting with document translation and autofill, users will be able to view real-time status (in progress, completed, failed) for individual files, bulk selections, or the full library. Completed status will include enriched details like language codes, glossary usage, and column extraction counts. This new pane will eventually replace the current “processing status” column, providing a more consistent and actionable experience.

items.title: Microsoft Edge: Adding support for viewing Sensitivity labels applied to a Microsoft Information Protection (MIP) Protected PDF
items.description: Enterprise customers can view sensitivity labels applied to MIP protected PDF to be well informed of the data classification to enable them to handle such sensitive documents. This change will be available in the new PDF viewer on Microsoft Edge.

items.title: Microsoft Edge: Built-in PDF reader powered by Adobe engine
items.description: Microsoft Edge will launch the new version of the built-in PDF reader that's powered by Adobe’s PDF rendering engine. The new PDF reader ensures that there's no loss of functionality and delivers an enhanced PDF experience. This experience includes richer rendering, improved performance, strong security for PDF handling, and greater accessibility.

items.title: Microsoft Purview Compliance Portal: Changes to case creation process in Purview portal when confirming alerts from Defender XDR portal and content retention periods in cases
items.description: With this release, alerts confirmed from the Defender XDR portal (security.microsoft.com) will not result in automatic case creation in the Purview portal. To create a case, Insider Risk Management analysts or investigators must manually click on the "Confirm all alerts & create case" button in the Purview portal from the alert that was previously confirmed through Defender XDR. When a case is created for a specific user based on the generated alert, related content such as online files and emails, is made available in the Content explorer tab. Additionally, any new content that generates or adds to an alert is included in the Content explorer for review during up to the 30 days from the creation of the Case. After these 30 days, new content identified for the user based on alerts will NOT be added to the Content explorer. To access new content, the existing case must be closed and a new Case created.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Search Skill (Copilot in Engage)
items.description: Engage Copilot now uses search skills to find and summarize relevant posts, with citations and direct links.

items.title: Microsoft Purview: Inline discovery of sensitive data shared over the network
items.description: Extension of Microsoft Purview policies to the network by integrating Purview with your existing Secure Access Service Edge (SASE) solution. Through this integration, admins can intercept and inspect traffic flowing through the network layer to identify the presence of sensitive data and enforce DLP policies on it.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Intelligent meeting recap available in multi-tenant set ups
items.description: Copilot users in business-to-business multi-tenant organization set ups can now view the intelligent meeting recap after the meeting from the resource tenant where the meeting was hosted.

items.title: Microsoft Defender for Office 365: Full Submissions experience in GCC
items.description: We are bringing GCC admin and user submission experience to parity with WW capabilities.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Create Copilot Pages on your mobile phone
items.description: Create Copilot Pages from Copilot Chat on your mobile phone to continue working on the go.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Endpoint Data Loss Prevention: Collection Policies: Scope classifiers and activity to track on all Windows devices
items.description: Allow customers to scope classification (SITs- Sensitive Information Types) and activities for scoped users.

items.title: Outlook: Custom Instructions for draft with Copilot
items.description: Give Copilot some instructions about your emails - like the tone, length, greeting - so your Copilot generated drafts sound more like you want them to. #newoutlookforwindow

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot generates the new presentation in a new file when starting from an existing presentation
items.description: Now, when creating a presentation using Copilot from an existing presentation, it will create the new presentation in a new file without affecting the original presentation

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot generates the new presentation in a new file when starting from an existing presentation
items.description: Now, when creating a presentation using Copilot from an existing presentation, it will create the new presentation in a new file without affecting the original presentation

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot generates the new presentation in a new file when starting from an existing presentation
items.description: Now, when creating a presentation using Copilot from an existing presentation, it will create the new presentation in a new file without affecting the original presentation

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Reference a TXT file when creating a presentation with Copilot
items.description: You can now reference a TXT file when you create a presentation with Copilot within the PowerPoint application.

items.title: Microsoft 365 app: Microsoft Places - Onboard to the Places Directory with AI
items.description: Seamlessly onboard to the Places Directory by using a new and improved AI-powered Initialize-Places PowerShell script. #MicrosoftPlaces

items.title: Access: Add zoom slider magnification to Microsoft Access
items.description: Access will add magnification slider (10% to 500%) in lower right of the application, similar to the feature in Word, PowerPoint, and Excel. It will also be keyboard accessible and available on the ribbon.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): [Copilot Extensibility] [b.2.3] Governance control for agents with file uploaded as knowledge source
items.description: For agents with uploaded files as knowledge source, admins now can regulate and manage including but not limited to agent filtering, reviewing sensitivity label, metadata, etc.

items.title: SharePoint: Advanced Page Analytics
items.description: SharePoint page analytics will add enhanced reporting capabilities including long-term data, distribution channel filtering, and reactions and promotions, data exports.

items.title: Microsoft Defender for Office 365: Ability to Disagree with Microsoft  submissions analysis
items.description: We are enabling the ability for SOC and admins to disagree with submission responses within the Submission experience and provide feedback to Microsoft on false negatives and false positives.

items.title: Microsoft Defender for Office 365: Additional actions include submit, allow/block, and trigger AIR from Advanced Hunting.
items.description: SoC  will be able to do submissions and tenant level block and trigger investigation actions from Advanced Hunting

items.title: Microsoft Defender for Office 365: Enhanced Take Action experience in Threat Explorer
items.description: SecOps can take multiple actions like purge emails, inline submissions, and tenant level block actions together through a single Take Action wizard.

items.title: SharePoint: Content Security Policy Control in Tenant Administration
items.description: SharePoint Online Tenant Administrators can now allow script sources for modern pages in SharePoint sites. This is particularly useful in scenarios where modern pages have custom code that load scripts (e.g. TypeScript code) from external sources like CDN. SharePoint will now report to administrators where are loaded from sources that have not been allowed giving administrators a way to identify those sources and take actions. Tenant Administrators can also enforce browsers to only load scripts from allowed sources. This behavior can be enabled using SharePoint Online Management Shell.

items.title: Microsoft Edge: Find on Page in Microsoft Edge for Business will soon be integrated with Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat
items.description: Microsoft Edge for Business plans to introduce Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat to Find on Page (CTRL+F).  This feature seeks to help users more easily find relevant content and save time.

items.title: Microsoft Purview Compliance Portal: Data Loss Prevention to restrict Microsoft 365 Copilot processing on emails with sensitivity labels
items.description: Microsoft Purview Data Loss Prevention (DLP) is extended to preventing Microsoft 365 Copilot from processing emails with sensitivity labels. This feature will allow DLP policies to provide detection of sensitivity labels in emails as enterprise grounding data and restrict access of the labeled emails in Microsoft 365 Copilot chat experiences. This feature only works for emails on or after 1/1/2025. #copilotcontrolsystem

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Glint admin can enable Copilot for the Company admin user role
items.description: Viva Glint's Company Admin role currently prevents editing of any role permissions, including feature controls for survey program reporting. While this restriction helps prevent accidental disruption of critical admin capabilities, it has emerged as a significant barrier to Copilot adoption. Customers must create and maintain redundant custom roles solely to enable Copilot access for Company Admin users, adding unnecessary complexity to deployment and ongoing management. This feature update will allow Company Admins to enable Copilot for themselves at the Viva Glint client user role level via a new toggle in General Settings. This enables Copilot across all eligible recurring and ad-hoc survey programs without altering the permissions architecture of the Company Admin role at the program level. All existing Company Admin user role permissions remain locked to preserve critical admin safeguards. This targeted change preserves essential admin role safeguards while removing a key friction point in Copilot deployment.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Language expansion coming in Microsoft 365 Copilot
items.description: The broader Microsoft 365 Copilot team are working on supporting 6 new languages across all M365 Copilot features. These are (in alphabetical order) Albanian, Filipino, Icelandic, Malay, Maltese, and Serbian (Cyrillic). The planned release of support for Kazakh language is delayed; we will provide updates as they become available

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: OneDrive support for Data Risk Assessments
items.description: Within Microsoft Purview Data Security Posture Management for AI, OneDrive will be added as a supported location in data risk assessments. #copilotcontrolsystem

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Automatically update your work location via your organization's Wi-Fi
items.description:
When users connect to their organization's Wi-Fi, Teams will soon be able to automatically update their work location to reflect the building they're working from.
This feature will be off by default. Tenant admins will decide whether to enable it and require end-users to opt-in.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Meeting option suggestions in classic Outlook for Windows
items.description: Classic Outlook for Windows will suggest meeting options based on your meeting details, helping you easily schedule meetings with optimized settings from within the scheduling form.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Sensitivity Labels for Loop Components
items.description: Sensitivity labels for Loop components - Users can set/apply/view sensitivity labels to loop components to classify and protect content based on its sensitivity level. The labels help enforce policies such as encryption, access control, and content marking to ensure that sensitive information is handled appropriately.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Copilot Analytics - Prompt category metrics for Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat
items.description: Viva Insights Copilot Dashboard will start showing Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat prompt category metrics within Copilot Chat (work) insights. #copilotcontrolsystem

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Catchup Skill (Copilot in Engage)
items.description: Catch up effortlessly on Home Feed or Community conversations since you last checked- this card will provide a personalized update to what you missed since you last logged into the Viva Engage homepage or since you last clicked into the Feed for a specific Community you follow

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Shared mailbox access for emails in Copilot Chat
items.description: Users with shared mailbox access will be able to ground Copilot Chat conversations in shared mailboxes.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Reference a TXT file when creating a presentation with Copilot
items.description: You can now reference a TXT file when you create a presentation with Copilot within the PowerPoint application.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Reference a TXT file when creating a presentation with Copilot
items.description: You can now reference a TXT file when you create a presentation with Copilot within the PowerPoint application.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Speaker attribution now  “On” by default in BYOD rooms with enhanced admin controls
items.description: New PowerShell setting (SpeakerAttributionBYOD in csTeamsAIPolicy), enabled by default, gives IT admins more control over speaker attribution in BYOD (bring your own device) meeting rooms. This enhances the experience for users by enabling clear speaker labels and richer in-meeting and post-meeting insights with Microsoft 365 Copilot. Users just enroll profiles via Teams Settings to be recognized.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Catch up on a summary of document comments in the top of your document
items.description: Copilot will have a Discussion tab in the top of your document to summarize open comments, helping you quickly understand what people have said in comments.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot surfaces key statistics in the top of a document
items.description: Copilot includes a summary at the top of key statistics from your Word document.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Catch up on a summary of document comments in the top of your document
items.description: Copilot will have a Discussion tab in the top of your document to summarize open comments, helping you quickly understand what people have said in comments.

items.title: SharePoint: OneDrive and SharePoint – Compress your PDF
items.description: OneDrive for Web now lets you reduce PDF file size with compress feature. You can choose from three different compression levels that best fit your needs.

items.title: Outlook: Improved interaction in the subject header section on Outlook on the Web and New Outlook for Windows
items.description: The subject header section that shows up at the top when reading an email will be improved. This includes the component that contains meeting information when looking at a meeting invitation and other similar components. The subject header section will be more sensitive to available space and allow for a more comfortable reading experience when on smaller screens or on displays with high scale factors. #newoutlookforwindows

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Metadata for Shared agent management in Microsoft 365 admin center
items.description: IT admins can view metadata for Shared agents in Microsoft 365 admin center similar to metadata information for line of business applications built by customer organization. It provides IT admins the opportunity to explore all data besides honoring UX filters for a seamless user experience.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Admins can easily manage orphaned agents with comprehensive lifecycle functionality
items.description: Admins will have the power to effectively manage the lifecycle of ownerless agents. They can easily filter, identify, block, or delete agents that are no longer associated with an owner, ensuring a streamlined and efficient workflow. #copilotcontrolsystem

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): People connectors for Microsoft 365 Copilot
items.description: People connectors for Microsoft 365 Copilot, based on top of Graph connectors, will integrate and enrich people data from various sources into Microsoft 365. This enriched data will enhance experiences in Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat, the profile card, and people search.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Employee Self-Service Agent in M365 Copilot
items.description: The Employee Self-Service Agent in M365 Copilot expedites answers for the most common workplace policy-related questions and takes action on key HR and IT related tasks, connecting employees to authorized knowledge bases and HR/IT systems of record for faster resolution time and a streamlined employee experience.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Preview Changes Before Sending Live in 'Manage what attendees see'
items.description: Following further review, this feature started rolling out in July 2025. We apologize for any inconvenience. An enhancement to the 'Manage what attendees see' feature, allowing organizers and presenters to preview changes to what is brought on or off the screen before sending them live to attendees. This capability is only available for Town hall.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Drafting on a selection includes being able to reference files, people, emails, and meetings
items.description: Just like when you're using Copilot to draft content on a blank line in your document, you can reference resources that provide context in addition to the content you've selected in your document.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Drafting on a selection includes being able to reference files, people, emails, and meetings
items.description: Just like when you're using Copilot to draft content on a blank line in your document, you can reference resources that provide context in addition to the content you've selected in your document.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Reference People from your enterprise in Copilot in Word
items.description: Users can now reference People from your enterprise while generating content in Word.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Bi-directional Calendar Syncing between Google Workspace and Microsoft Teams
items.description: Businesses using Google Workspace for email and calendaring can now enable bidirectional synchronization with Microsoft Teams through the Teams Admin app. This enhanced sync ensures that events created in either platform are seamlessly reflected in both, improving scheduling efficiency and minimizing the risk of missed meetings. With this update, all calendar events—including incoming, outgoing, existing, and new—are fully synchronized. This feature is being rolled out gradually. When rollout is complete, you can sync up to 50,000 users per tenant.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Unified attachment flow on Teams Mobile
items.description: Introducing a new content picker for Teams Mobile! Attach any type of content, whether files or media, from the paperclip icon in the compose overflow menu. Our unified attach flow makes it easy and intuitive to attach content from any source location.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Specify who has control of production tools in Teams Town hall
items.description: Following further review, this feature started rolling out in July 2025.  A new option in Town hall lets organizers designate who has control of production tools during the event. Organizers can select specific individuals who will be able to start the event, manage what attendees see, and end the event, ensuring a smoother and more organized event experience. Available on Teams desktop app and coming soon for Teams Rooms on Windows.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Security Posture Management for AI
items.description: Microsoft Purview AI Hub has been rebranded to Microsoft Purview Data Security Posture Management for AI (DSPM for AI). Microsoft Purview Data Security Posture Management for AI is a centralized location to gain insights into generative AI activity including the sensitive data flowing in AI prompts.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Security Posture Management for AI - Data Assessments
items.description: Data assessments in Microsoft Purview Data Security Posture Management for AI provides a way for admins to drive data security outcomes by viewing default assessments, reviewing the data sensitivity and user accesses on locations, and performing remediation actions to mitigate risk.

items.title: Microsoft Purview Compliance Portal: Data Compliance to support Generative AI Applications
items.description:
Detection, processing and storage of interactions done on Enterprise AI and AI applications such as Security Copilot, Copilot Studio and others under Microsoft Purview Data Compliance solutions including Data Lifecycle Management, eDiscovery, and Communication Compliance will begin using a pay-as-you-go pricing model on May 1 in preparation for general availability. Microsoft Purview Audit will only use pay-as-you-go pricing for audit logs related to non-Microsoft Enterprise AI and AI applications. Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat data (with or without a Copilot license) will not be impacted by these new pay-as-you-go meters. 
Microsoft Purview Communication Compliance provides the tools to help organizations detect regulatory compliance violations (for example SEC or FINRA), such as sensitive or confidential information, harassing or threatening language, and sharing of adult content. Built with privacy by design, usernames are pseudonymized by default, role-based access controls are built in, investigators are opted in by an admin, and audit logs are in place to ensure user-level privacy.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Detect sensitive content that's being shared in meetings (Premium)
items.description: Screen content shared during a meeting is protected by detecting sensitive content and alerting the presenter and organizers when it appears.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Endpoint DLP Mac device management support for additional MDM solutions
items.description: Endpoint DLP is extending support to Mac devices managed by additional third party MDM solutions other than the currently supported JAMF or Intune.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Agents in Copilot Chat available on Edge Sidebar
items.description: Use agents in Copilot Chat on Edge Sidebar to simplify tasks.

items.title: Access: Modernize Access Forms and Reports to work well on Large Format Monitors
items.description: Remove the 22-inch size limit and modernize Access forms and reports work well on large format monitors and provide responsive behavior for different form factors.

items.title: Microsoft Excel: Extending support for Insights Services to GCC-H and DoD sovereign clouds
items.description: GCC-H and DoD sovereign cloud customers will be able to use features in Excel run by Insights Services, including Analyze Data found on the Data tab.

items.title: PowerPoint: Email Notification Context Previews for Files Protected with Microsoft Purview
items.description: Notification emails for mentions, tasks, comments, and replies will now contain context previews even when the source document is encrypted, and the email will inherit the document's security policies.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Pulse - Customizable organizational statement for authors and responders
items.description: Organizations can provide employees with guidelines based on their company policies as survey authors and respondents, along with default Pulse privacy guidance.

items.title: Microsoft Clipchamp: Camera Update
items.description: Camera in our editor will be updated to a newer version with improved recording controls and command bar options.

items.title: Microsoft Clipchamp: Windows Widget
items.description: With Microsoft Clipchamp Windows widget, Windows 11 users will have a quick way to launch screen recording, camera recording and create video projects.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Endpoint Data Loss Prevention: Advanced label-based protection for all files on devices
items.description: Turning this feature on will allow users to work on files, including files other than Office and PDF files, with sensitivity labels that apply access control settings in an unencrypted state on their devices. Endpoint DLP will continue to monitor and enforce access control and label-based protection on these files even in unencrypted state and automatically encrypt them before they’re transferred outside from a user’s device. This feature is supported only on Windows devices.

items.title: Microsoft 365 admin center: Manage SharePoint agents via Agents page
items.description: Admins can manage SharePoint agents as shared agents in the Agents page of the Microsoft 365 admin center. They will be able to block/unblock agents directly from Agent inventory.

items.title: Microsoft Defender for Office 365: Hunting on Teams Messages
items.description: We are introducing three new Advaned Hunting tables designed to facilitate hunting of Teams messages containing URLs within your organization.

items.title: Word: Email Notification Context Previews for Files Protected with Microsoft Purview
items.description: This is being removed as a duplicate of 486820

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Endpoint Data Loss Prevention - Pause and Resume support for printer scenarios
items.description: Pause and Resume support for printer scenarios for customers trying to override a DLP soft warning policy tip when submitting a print job. Before this rollout, the user must reinitiate the print job for the intended result. After this rollout, the override will be stored temporarily, and the print job will execute.

items.title: Microsoft 365 Admin Center: Control Settings for agents with actions in Teams Toolkit
items.description: To give admins control over whether agent makers can publish advanced agents (agents with actions) for their tenants, we are introducing a new control in the M365 admin center. This control specifically applies to advanced agents created from Teams Toolkit. #copilotcontrolsystem

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Lifecycle Management - Apply a retention policy to Microsoft Planner content
items.description: Introducing Data lifecycle management capabilities for Microsoft Planner. Compliance admins can now create a retention policy to manage content located in Microsoft Planner such as tasks for plans associated with an Microsoft 365 Group.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Endpoint DLP - Edge to enforce USB, network, and printer group restrictions on files
items.description: Purview Admins can now use either Removable USB device, Network Share, and/or Printer groups within DLP policies, these restrictions are now extensible to the Edge browser experience.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Endpoint DLP: - App or App Group Restriction support for Edge browser
items.description: Previously, Purview Admins could not restrict Edge browser access to sensitive files through Restricted apps or app groups. With this feature, apps or app groups can be configured to be blocked in Edge, including a message showing policy violation info.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): SharePoint agent web part
items.description: SharePoint site page authors can add SharePoint agents to their pages with an agent web part, allowing end users to easily access and interact with SharePoint agents directly from the site pages.

items.title: Outlook: Change how Shared Mailboxes are displayed in the folder pane
items.description: To conform with the behavior of classic Outlook for Windows, we are moving Shared Mailboxes to be displayed in the same way that Accounts are displayed and adding a Shared icon to give users a visual distinction between standard mailboxes and Shared Mailboxes. #newoutlookforwindows

items.title: Microsoft 365: Copilot Prompt Gallery - Share a prompt to a Microsoft Teams team
items.description: Share custom prompts with members of a Microsoft Teams team from the Copilot Prompt Gallery App, allowing team members to easily discover and utilize these prompts in Copilot Prompt Gallery App.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Work context suggestions in Copilot Chat ContextIQ menu
items.description: Copilot Chat will suggest prompts and work context you have access to as you type in the prompt, helping you find relevant information for your conversations.

items.title: Outlook: Edit from This and All Following Events
items.description: You can now edit a recurring event from a certain date forward by selecting "This and All Following Events"

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Enhancements to global exclusions in IRM settings
items.description: In this update, we are making the below enhancements to IRM exclusions to reduce alert noise. 1. Keyword logic update for email - An email will be excluded from scoring only when all the attachments match the keyword exclusions or email subject matches the keyword exclusions. This will be helpful to reduce the email signature noise which commonly contains keyword "image". 2. Keyword exclusions on both target and source file paths - For signals like file copied to removable media, keyword exclusions apply on both target and source file paths. 3. File path exclusions for removable media - We will start supporting file path exclusions for removable media. 4. Exclusion support for browser - Domain exclusions are now supported for browsing indicators. Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, data leakage, and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies based on their own internal policies, governance, and organizational requirements. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Face recognition in Teams Rooms on Windows with Cloud IntelliFrame
items.description: If facial recognition is enabled in organization policies and you've enrolled your profile via Teams Settings, Teams Rooms on Windows using Cloud IntelliFrame will recognize you, list you in the meeting roster, and optimize camera views for participants making hybrid meetings feel like you are all in the room together. This feature available with Teams Rooms Pro.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Select some text, and instantly get helpful options from Copilot
