items.description: The Copilot icon in your document margin gives you a variety of actions you can take on your selected text. One click lets you rewrite, get editorial coaching, and more.

items.title: Outlook: Calendar support for copying, cutting, and pasting events and appointments
items.description: Customers can now copy, cut, and paste meetings and appointments on their calendar in the new Outlook using CTRL+C, CTRL+X, and CTRL+V keyboard shortcuts. #newoutlookforwindows

items.title: Microsoft Edge: Monitoring in the Edge management service
items.description: The Edge management service offers an overview of insights about your managed Edge instances and suggests actions you can take. For out-of-date devices, you can easily schedule updates or notify users to update their browsers to avoid workflow interruptions.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): AI Administrator will be able to manage Microsoft Copilot Dashboard settings.
items.description: Expanding the Microsoft Copilot Dashboard admin settings to AI Administrator role which is the newly announced Entra role. Admin users assigned with the AI Administrator role can efficiently manage Microsoft Copilot Dashboard without the vast privileges of Global admin permissions.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot Prompt Gallery - Share a prompt with a co-worker
items.description: Easily create, save, and share your favorite prompts using Copilot Prompt Gallery, inspiring your co-workers to achieve more with Copilot.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Copilot Analytics - Unified experience for Copilot Dashboard and Viva Insights analyst workbench
items.description: A new, unified experience for leaders, delegates and analysts that combines the Copilot Dashboard and advanced Copilot reports in Viva Insights analyst workbench into one application.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Select camera in pre-join and during meeting
items.description: Users can select an internal or external camera, or keep it turned off, before joining or during Teams meetings.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot advanced text analysis in Excel
items.description: Copilot can now analyze text by identifying themes or sentiments, cite examples in the data, and insert a column with theme/sentiment labels.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Easily select a template while you create a new PowerPoint presentation with Copilot
items.description: When creating a new presentation with Copilot in PowerPoint, choose a template from your organization's collection for on-brand presentations, or select from Microsoft's handpicked templates, ensuring the new presentation is built as per your chosen template.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Easily select a template while you create a new PowerPoint presentation with Copilot
items.description: When creating a new presentation with Copilot in PowerPoint, choose a template from your organization's collection for on-brand presentations, or select from Microsoft's handpicked templates, ensuring the new presentation is built as per your chosen template.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Easily select a template while you create a new PowerPoint presentation with Copilot
items.description: When creating a new presentation with Copilot in PowerPoint, choose a template from your organization's collection for on-brand presentations, or select from Microsoft's handpicked templates, ensuring the new presentation is built as per your chosen template.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Admins will be able to define rules to automate agent lifecycle management.
items.description:
Admins will have the ability to set up rules for various scenarios, such as -

1. Auto block risky agents.
2. Auto publish agents that meet a criterion.
3. Auto install agents that meet a criterion. 

. #copilotcontrolsystem

items.title: Microsoft 365 App: Availability of the Cloud Policy service for Microsoft 365 Government GCC-H and DoD
items.description: The Cloud Policy service allows Microsoft 365 administrators to configure policies for Microsoft 365 apps and assign these policies using Microsoft 365 or Entra ID groups. Once configured, these policies are automatically enforced as users sign in and use Microsoft 365 apps and services. The initial release will support policies for Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise on Windows and future updates will bring support for additional applications and platforms. For additional information about the Cloud Policy service, refer to "Overview of the Cloud Policy service for Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise".

items.title: SharePoint: M365/SharePoint Agent Insights for SharePoint Administrators
items.description: Rich insights on SharePoint agents for content governance as part of SharePoint Advanced Management controls.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Moderator-Governed Meetings for Information Barrier Compliance (Premium)
items.description: This new Microsoft Teams Meeting feature enables secure collaboration between users separated by information barriers (also known as ethical walls) under strict compliance oversight. With this capability, meetings involving participants from restricted groups can proceed only when a designated meeting moderator—assigned by the compliance department—is present. If the last moderator leaves the meeting,  the meeting automatically ends. This ensures real-time compliance monitoring and maintains regulatory integrity during sensitive cross-barrier interactions.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: DVR (Digital Video Recording) capabilities for town halls on iOS and Android
items.description: Users can now interact with an instance of a live streaming town hall instance in the same way they would a recorded piece of content when viewing via iOS and Android. DVR functionality in town hall enables event attendees to pause and move forward or back within a town hall, navigate to any previously-streamed timestamp, and other abilities that make interacting with a town hall more convenient and makes it easier to digest the content being presented. This feature is available for all town halls regardless of the license assigned to the organizers.

items.title: Excel: Expanded eligibility for Python in Excel
items.description: Python in Excel allows you to bring the capabilities of Python directly into the Excel grid. With this release, we are expanding the eligibility for Python in Excel to include users with Microsoft 365 commercial licenses that only have access to the Microsoft 365 online apps, such as Office 365 E1 or Microsoft 365 Business Basic. Previously, Python in Excel was exclusive to users with paid Microsoft 365 commercial licenses that provided access to the Microsoft 365 desktop apps, such as Office 365 E3 and E5 licenses. As a part of this feature, users with access to Excel will be able to add Python formulas directly into their workbooks without any installation required. These Python formulas will be run by Excel in a secure container on the Microsoft Cloud with enterprise-level security as a compliant Microsoft 365 connected experience.

items.title: Outlook: Import calendars and contacts from PST file to mailbox in new Outlook for Windows
items.description: With this update of support for .pst files (a.k.a. Outlook Data File) in the new Outlook for Windows, users will be able to import calendars and contacts from .pst file to mailbox. Future releases of new Outlook will expand the support for .pst file capabilities. #newoutlookforwindows #pstfilesupport.

items.title: Outlook: Grid keyboard navigation in calendar month view via arrow keys in new Outlook for Windows and Web
items.description: When focused on the calendar grid, you will be able to navigate the time slots on the calendar via left/right/up/down arrow keys in month view. #newoutlookforwindows

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Call quality reports for BYOD rooms in the Pro Management portal
items.description: As with Microsoft Teams Rooms, admins can now access detailed call quality reports for BYOD rooms with associated peripherals in the Pro Management portal. These reports include call history and session details that help diagnose network, audio, and video issues. Reports in the Pro Management portal requires a Teams Shared Devices license for the room.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Line key support for shared line and call transfers
items.description: This feature will enable you to assign shared lines to a line key and view the boss and delegates of the line along with their presence on Teams Phone devices with touch screens. This feature allows delegates to pick up calls on behalf of the boss by pressing the line key and join active calls. Additionally, users will be able to assign the transfer action to the line key, enabling them to transfer active calls by simply pressing that line key.

items.title: Microsoft Purview: Insider Risk Management - Data Security Investigation integration
items.description: Launch a pre-scoped Data Security Investigation (DSI) from an IRM case. When a data security admin identifies a risky user who needs deeper investigation, they can launch a pre-scoped investigation directly from an IRM case, allowing them to view content analysis related to that user and better assess post-incident data impact.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Town hall usage reports in TAC will have all the relevant usage data related to town hall events in the tenant.
items.description: When Town hall was released, there were some columns/data related to each Town hall event that were missing in the TAC usage reports for IT Admins. Now all the relevant usage related data are added to the town hall usage reports available in the TAC portal for Admins.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Expanded and enhanced peripheral support for BYOD spaces
items.description: With room and desk peripheral support expanded to include docking stations and webcams, Teams users can seamlessly connect and utilize audio and video peripherals for enhanced experiences in bring your own device (BYOD) spaces. IT admins can benefit from automatic association of devices to a space, device inventory, and detailed reports for peripherals in the Pro Management portal. Reports in the Pro Management portal require a Teams Shared Devices license for the room, and reports for desks are in public preview.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Teams Button Support on Multiple Connected Peripheral Devices
items.description: You can now use the Teams button across peripheral devices without having to manually select a specific device in the Teams devices settings. This ensures a more seamless experience navigating across multiple certified for Microsoft Teams personal peripheral USB devices (with a wire or a dongle) connected to the same host device (such as your laptop). For example, you can use the Teams button on headset A to bring up the meeting pre-join screen, then use the Teams button on headset B to join the meeting, and then use the Teams button on your connected speakerphone to raise hand in the meeting, etc.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Enhancements to global exclusions in IRM settings
items.description:
In this update, we are making the below enhancements to Insider Risk Management (IRM) exclusions to reduce alert noise.
1. Keyword logic update for email - An email will be excluded from scoring only when all the attachments match the keyword exclusions or email subject matches the keyword exclusions. This will be helpful to reduce the email signature noise which commonly contains keyword "image".
2. Keyword exclusions on both target and source file paths - For signals like file copied to removable media, keyword exclusions apply on both target and source file paths.
3. File path exclusions for removable media - We will start supporting file path exclusions for removable media.
4. Exclusion support for browser - Domain exclusions are now supported for browsing indicators.

Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, data leakage, and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies based on their own internal policies, governance, and organizational requirements. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy.

items.title: PowerPoint: Refreshed Placeholders in PowerPoint on Desktop
items.description: Placeholders in PowerPoint are getting refreshed to look more modern and provide clear guidance on the object that can be inserted. Image placeholders now allow you to pick from a variety of sources to insert an image. We apologize for the inconvenience, but we are rolling this out early to resolve an issue that some customers were experiencing

items.title: Excel: Python in Excel for the web (GCC)
items.description: After further review, we need to roll this back. We apologize for any inconvenience. Python in Excel allows you to bring the capabilities of Python directly into the Excel grid. As a part of this feature release, eligible users with access to Excel for the web will be able to add Python formulas directly into their workbooks without any installation required. These Python formulas will be run by Excel in a secure container on the Microsoft Cloud with enterprise-level security as a compliant Microsoft 365 connected experience.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Catch up on a summary of document comments in the top of your document
items.description: Copilot will have a Discussion tab in the top of your document to summarize open comments, helping you quickly understand what people have said in comments.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: New Teams calendar available to Education customers
items.description: The new calendar in Teams will be available to Education customers. The new calendar in Teams is designed to be familiar and reliable, as it’s one unified calendar that works across new Outlook for Windows, Outlook on the web, Microsoft Places, and now Microsoft Teams. With this update, the new Teams calendar will be enabled by default, and users can turn it off from the "New calendar" toggle at the top right of the calendar app in Teams.

items.title: Outlook: Import calendars and contacts from PST file to mailbox in new Outlook for Windows
items.description: With this update of support for .pst files (a.k.a. Outlook Data File) in the new Outlook for Windows, users will be able to import calendars and contacts from .pst file to mailbox. Future releases of new Outlook will expand the support for .pst file capabilities. #newoutlookforwindows #pstfilesupport.

items.title: SharePoint: Dashboard in Sites
items.description: The dashboard layout webpart will be available on all sites and pages. Currently the dashboard webpart is limited to Home Sites, it will be extended to Team Sites and Communication Sites

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Engage - Report a Conversation in new admin center
items.description: Report a Conversation feature configuration will soon be available in the new Engage admin center, moved from the legacy Yammer admin center. This feature allows admins to set-up a reporting mechanism for Engage conversations in their network. There are no changes to the end-user experience.

items.title: Word: Email Notification Context Previews for Files Protected with Microsoft Purview
items.description: Notification emails for mentions, tasks, comments, and replies will now contain context previews even when the source document is encrypted, and the email will inherit the document's security policies.

items.title: SharePoint: SharePoint eSignature for Microsoft Word
items.description: This feature is available to tenants that enable SharePoint eSignature in the Microsoft Admin Center and have Word clients on the Current Channel.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Ultra-low latency (ULL) attendee experience for Teams Town hall
items.description: With Ultra-low latency, attendees will now be able to view and participate in a town hall instance at a much lower latency than before, ensuring they are in sync with content being shared by presenters and organizers. This update significantly improves the attendee experience compared to the typical 20-30 second delay experienced in the past. This feature is available for town hall organizers with a Teams Premium license.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal:  New Inline Protection controls for AI apps in Edge for Business
items.description: With the new inline protection capability for Edge for Business, you can prevent data leakage across the various ways that users interact with sensitive data in the browser, including typing of text directly into a web application or generative AI prompt. Starting with some of the top consumer GenAI apps (ChatGPT, Google Gemini, and DeepSeek), admins will be able to block typed prompts containing sensitive data.  The inline protection capability complements existing endpoint DLP controls for uploading or pasting sensitive content in the browser.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Loss Prevention - New inline data protection in Edge for Business for unmanaged Windows and macOS devices
items.description: Following further review, we mistakenly marked the roadmap as "launched." The correct status is In Development. We apologize the inconvenience. When using Microsoft Edge for Business as the secure enterprise browser, Admins in Purview DLP can now configure policies that apply protections directly in the Edge browser that target scenarios where users on unmanaged (or BYO) devices are sharing data to or exfiltrating data from org-managed cloud apps (apps which use Entra authentication for user sign-in).

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Learning -  Support AAD based security groups across Viva learning
items.description: Support AAD based security groups across Viva learning.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Learning - Ability to view inferred skills and course recommendations
items.description: Learners would be able to select skills for learning, view inferred skills and courses recommendations based on inferred skills. Inferred skills are generated by taking users activity in M365 ecosystem into account.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Microsoft Purview Data Security Posture Management for AI- additional Microsoft Copilot integrations
items.description: Microsoft Purview Data Security Posture Management for AI support for Fabric Copilot and Security Copilot.

items.title: Outlook: Agents for Microsoft 365 Copilot available in Copilot Chat in Outlook for Mac
items.description: We will be adding declarative agents support in Copilot Chat in Outlook. This roadmap item tracks availability in Outlook for Mac.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot Prompt Gallery - Company-wide prompt publishing
items.description: Organizations can build their own collections of prompts that are tailored to their business needs and workflows and distribute these to all users within the tenant.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Streamlined, unified role-based access controls (RBAC) for Teams device management
items.description: IT admins now benefit from unified role-based access controls across the Teams admin center and Teams Rooms Pro Management portals. This streamlines device management ensuring smooth transitions between portals and consistency in environment management.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Learning - Custom user mapping for SuccessFactors integration
items.description: Admins can now specify the user mapping attributes in the LMS setup form.

items.title: Outlook: Add folders from a .pst file to Favorites in new Outlook for Windows
items.description: With this update of support for .pst files (a.k.a. Outlook Data File) in the new Outlook for Windows, users will be only able to add folders from a .pst file to Favorites. Future releases of new Outlook will expand the support for .pst file capabilities. #newoutlookforwindows #pstfilesupport.

items.title: Outlook: Add folders from a .pst file to Favorites in new Outlook for Windows
items.description: With this update of support for .pst files (a.k.a. Outlook Data File) in the new Outlook for Windows, users will be only able to add folders from a .pst file to Favorites. Future releases of new Outlook will expand the support for .pst file capabilities. #newoutlookforwindows #pstfilesupport.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Streamlined Microsoft 365 Certified App Management in Teams Admin Center
items.description: This feature allows Microsoft 365 administrators to enable Microsoft 365 certified SaaS applications within their tenant through org-wide settings for third-party apps. Admins can choose to allow a subset of applications that have already been verified against industry security and compliance standards. This ensures organizations can confidently adopt apps while maintaining governance and reducing approval overhead.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Migration Tool for Teams
items.description: Customers will now be able to migrate content seamlessly from Slack public and private channels to Teams shared, public, and private channels. A new first-party migration tool in the Microsoft Admin Center (MAC) will allow admins to review which Slack channels they wish to migrate, then perform content migration to Teams.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Endpoint Data Loss Prevention - Import and Search function support for Sensitive service domains group
items.description: Purview Endpoint DLP improve the management of Sensitive service domains group by allowing you to import a URL group and search specific URL across all groups.

items.title: Outlook: Move to in the pop-out ribbon in New Outlook and Outlook for Web
items.description: The "Move To" option is now available in the pop-out ribbon in New Outlook and Outlook for Web, making it easier to organize emails. Quickly move messages to any folder without switching back to the main window. This update ensures a seamless and consistent email management experience.  #newoutlookforwindows

items.title: Outlook: Category Shortcuts in the New Outlook for Windows
items.description: Easily organize your inbox with quick-access category shortcuts! The shortcuts you loved in Classic Outlook will be available in the new Outlook for Windows, making it easier than ever to categorize emails. #newoutlookforwindows

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Group-less campaigns in Viva Amplify
items.description: We are streamlining the campaign management experience in Viva Amplify and campaigns will no longer be tied to M365 groups. As such, M365 Group admins will no longer be a required role to configure Viva Amplify and only SharePoint admin role will be required. Also, when you create a campaign, there will no longer be a campaign channel tied to the Viva Amplify campaign, simplifying the campaign creation experience.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Add a presenter from the participant roster in a town hall or webinar
items.description: Organizers and presenters can quickly add a missing presenter to an ongoing town hall or webinar by calling them directly from the participant roster. Once the missing presenter accepts the call, they instantly join as a presenter, automatically joining the Green Room (if enabled) and added to the event group chat.

items.title: OneDrive: New Folder Anyone Link Permission: View & Upload
items.description: We're introducing a new 'View and Upload' permission for folder 'Anyone' links in the OneDrive Admin Sharing Settings. This feature allows tenants to restrict folder links to 'Anyone can view' while still enabling the 'Request Files' functionality. It offers tenants more granular control over content access, ensures compliance with internal policies, and helps administrators maintain a higher level of data governance.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: eDiscovery - Efficient Review with Advanced Minimization Algorithms
items.description: Sophisticated algorithms analyze the review set and pick out the best set of documents to review while hiding redundant information. A new analytics relationship view and detailed reports for each analytic run through the new unified reporting format allow you to have confidence in the results. The analytical information is available in both our new insights experience and export load files, allowing you to easily adopt this efficiency boost into any workflow.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Security Investigations
items.description: Microsoft Purview Data Security Investigations empowers data security teams to find and mitigate data risk from sensitive data exposure using generative AI-powered deep content analysis enriched with activity signals.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: New Microsoft Teams chat and channels experience in GCC High and DoD
items.description: The new, streamlined chat and channels experience makes it easier to stay on top of what matters most and organize your digital workspace. Catch up on chat, channels and teams in one place, create custom sections to organize conversations by topics, use filters to triage messages and more.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: New Microsoft Teams chat and channels experience in GCC
items.description: The new, streamlined chat and channels experience makes it easier to stay on top of what matters most and organize your digital workspace. Catch up on chat, channels and teams in one place, create custom sections to organize conversations by topics, use filters to triage messages and more.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Personal meeting templates (Premium)
items.description: Personal meeting templates enable users to pre-save meeting configurations (meeting options) and schedule meetings quickly with one click.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot Prompt Gallery - Share a prompt to a Microsoft Team's team
items.description: Share custom prompts with members of a Microsoft Teams team from the Copilot Prompt Gallery in Copilot Chat, allowing team members to easily discover and utilize these prompts in Copilot Prompt Gallery.

items.title: Microsoft Edge: Intune policies in the Edge management service
items.description: Admins now can set Intune policies via the Edge management service, alongside the existing cloud policies. This enables admins to deploy both browser policies in the cloud and Intune policies from a single pane, making it easy to keep users safe and the browser workflow streamlined. This feature comes along with a new policy creation wizard that will streamline the creation process into a comprehensive, step-by-step flow.

items.title: Outlook: Read-only access to contacts within a PST file in new Outlook for Windows
items.description: With this update of support for .pst files (a.k.a. Outlook Data File) in the new Outlook for Windows, users will be able to browse and read contacts within a .pst file. Future releases of new Outlook will expand the support for .pst file capabilities. #newoutlookforwindows #pstfilesupport.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Slide control for presenters
items.description: Meeting or event presenters can now share control of slides with fellow presenters eliminating manual slide changes and maintaining a smooth flow during meetings or webinars.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Copilot Dashboard Trendline Additions
items.description: Copilot Dashboard users can now visualize trends in additional key adoption and impact metrics over time to more quickly identify patterns and opportunities in employee adoption for better licensing decisions. Users will be able to now view Adoption metrics on either a monthly or weekly timeframe for specific groups of interest, as well as deep dive into Impact metrics like Copilot Assisted Hours, Actions Taken, and feature-specific dimensions.

items.title: Outlook: Large Audience Warnings in Outlook for iOS and Android
items.description: Users are warned when they are emailing a large number of recipients which can help them make the correct decision about wording, tone, and content.

items.title: Outlook: Create and save email templates in the new Outlook for Windows
items.description: The template feature in the new Outlook allows users to create and save email templates for quick and consistent communication, streamlining the process of sending repetitive messages. Additionally, it allows for the seamless import of templates saved as .oft files. #newoutlookforwindows

items.title: Outlook: Create and save email templates in the new Outlook for Windows
items.description: The template feature in the new Outlook allows users to create and save email templates for quick and consistent communication, streamlining the process of sending repetitive messages. Additionally, it allows for the seamless import of templates saved as .oft files. #newoutlookforwindows

items.description: With this update of support for .pst files (a.k.a. items.title: Outlook: search emails while offline in the new Outlook for Windows
items.description: We are adding more functionality to offline mode in the new Outlook for Windows. You will now be able to do basic search functions without internet connection or when the search service fails. #newoutlookforwindows

items.title: Outlook: Read-only access to calendars within a PST file in new Outlook for Windows
items.description: With this update of support for .pst files (a.k.a. Outlook Data File) in the new Outlook for Windows, users will be able to browse and read calendars and events within a .pst file. Future releases of new Outlook will expand the support for .pst file capabilities. #newoutlookforwindows #pstfilesupport.

Future releases of new Outlook will expand the support for .pst file capabilities. #newoutlookforwindows #pstfilesupport.

items.description: With this update of support for .pst files (a.k.a. Outlook Data File) in the new Outlook for Windows, users will be able to schedule an export of an entire mailbox (emails, calendars, and contacts)  or a specific mailbox folder to a .pst file. Future releases of new Outlook will expand the support for .pst file capabilities. #newoutlookforwindows #pstfilesupport.

Future releases of new Outlook will expand the support for .pst file capabilities. #newoutlookforwindows #pstfilesupport.

items.title: Outlook: Import emails from PST file to mailbox in new Outlook for Windows
items.description: With this update of support for .pst files (a.k.a. Outlook Data File) in the new Outlook for Windows, users will be able to import emails from .pst file to mailbox. Future releases of new Outlook will expand the support for .pst file capabilities. #newoutlookforwindows #pstfilesupport.

items.title: Outlook: Import emails from PST file to mailbox in new Outlook for Windows
items.description: With this update of support for .pst files (a.k.a. Outlook Data File) in the new Outlook for Windows, users will be able to import emails from .pst file to mailbox. Future releases of new Outlook will expand the support for .pst file capabilities. #newoutlookforwindows #pstfilesupport.

items.title: Outlook: Group messages as conversation for PST files in new Outlook for Windows
items.description: With this update of support for .pst files (a.k.a. Outlook Data File) in the new Outlook for Windows, users will be able to group messages as conversation for emails within .pst file. Future releases of new Outlook will expand the support for .pst file capabilities, #newoutlookforwindows, #pstfilesupport.

items.title: Whiteboard: Text Sizing Feature
items.description: The Text Sizing feature offers users the ability to: 1. Adjust Font Sizes: Increase or decrease font sizes as needed. 2. Preset Font Sizes: Choose from preset font sizes for convenience. 3. Custom Text Size: Input custom text sizes for enhanced clarity. This feature enhances readability, improves clarity, and establishes a structured visual hierarchy, ensuring well-organized and easily comprehensible content on the board.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Endpoint Data Loss Prevention - Network share coverage and exclusion support on Mac endpoints
items.description: With this feature, sensitive data in files stored in network shares and mapped network drives will be protected by DLP policies across Mac endpoints as well.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal : MDM-independent support for Endpoint DLP on MacOS devices
items.description: Endpoint DLP is extending support to MacOS devices independent of the MDM solution used to deploy (previously supported through JAMF or Intune).

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Pop-out live captions and Real-time-Text (RTT) in meetings
items.description: When you are in meetings or calls, you will be able to pop out, drag, and resize live captions (including live translated captions), and real-time-text (RTT) from the main meeting window. This enables you to position the captions and RTT wherever you prefer on your screen, so you can easily focus on the meeting while viewing the incoming text in a position most comfortable for you.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Real-Time Text in Teams Meetings and Calls
items.description: Real-time Text (RTT) is a fast, accessible, and immediate communication method that transmits text character by character as it is typed. It is particularly valuable in various calling and meeting scenarios where it enables deaf and hard-of-hearing individuals, neurodiverse users, and those with speech-related disabilities to engage in real-time conversations through text.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Engage - Create articles and questions more easily with the updated "Create new" button.
items.description:
We are excited to announce the addition of two post creation options—Article and Question—to the centralized creation button in Viva Engage for premium users. Starting April 2025, a Viva Engage premium licensed user will be able to create an article or a question post type directly by clicking on the "Create new" button, easing the process of creation of these post types, while also helping users discover them quicker. Kindly note that this roll out does not entail adding new types of content creation, but brings forth a unified and easier way to create these post types when a user is already licensed to use them.
By 'Viva Engage premium licensed user', we mean this feature is available for users licensed to the Microsoft Viva Suite or the Microsoft Viva Employee Communications and Communities Suite.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Learning - Detailed error description for SuccessFactors sync failures
items.description: Sync failure details pop-up will now have detailed error description and next steps.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Loss Prevention - DLP Policy Tip Support in Outlook for Mac
items.description: DLP policy tips for Microsoft Outlook for Mac provide real-time notifications to users when their email contains sensitive information that violates organizational policies. Users can see policy tips directly in the mail tip UI and have the option to remove non-compliant recipients or override the policy if necessary. This feature ensures compliance by alerting users to potential data loss risks before sending emails.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Designer is now part of Copilot, enhanced with new template and slide suggestions
items.description: Designer is now part of Copilot. Copilot suggestions now brings you familiar Designer slide layout and presentation template suggestions in a vertical gallery, along with new capabilities.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Teams Town hall Organizer/Co-Organizer/Presenter Join as Attendee
items.description: Event crew members will soon be able to join a live Town hall as an Attendee during the event to monitor the experience for viewers.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Townhall concurrent attendees increase to 100,000
items.description: Organizers of town hall instances can now reach wider audience in a single event with an expansion to a maximum of 100,000 simultaneous attendees. This increase serves as a significant jump from the previous attendee cap of 50,000 for organizers with a Teams Premium license. The quality and stability of town halls up to this new limit will remain constant, providing high-quality and reliable content to participants. For events with more than 20,000 concurrent attendees, some interactivity features are disabled for all attendees. Organizations can get support for audiences up to 100,000 concurrent attendees by selecting the Max Capacity limit to be as high as desired up to 100,000. Reaching out to the Microsoft 365 Live Event Assistance Program (LEAP) for assistance (Microsoft 365 Live Event Assistance Program – Microsoft Adoption) is recommended for every event. This feature is available for town hall organizers that have an active Teams Premium license.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Pulse - Authoring with M365 Copilot
items.description: Viva Pulse authors can now work with M365 Copilot to add a question, rewrite a question, and create a survey from scratch to quickly create and send their surveys to their teams to collect feedback. M365 Copilot can seamlessly capture the author's needs to recommend survey questions that fit their unique scenario. #copilotcontrolsystem

items.title: Outlook: New Outlook for Windows - Reply To header
items.description: Users will be able to toggle a "Reply to" field in the email compose form, which will allow them to add one or multiple addresses which will be used as the recipients for any replies to that message. #newoutlookforwindows

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Join as attendees in Microsoft town hall and webinars from Teams Rooms on Windows
items.description: Microsoft Teams Rooms on Windows can now join town halls, webinars, and structured meetings in Teams as attendees. You can attend directly from the invited Teams Room, with the same features that attendees have for all events. Available in Teams Rooms Pro.

items.title: Microsoft Purview: Discovery of sensitive data sharing to any cloud application or website (inc. GenAI) via network layer
items.description:
With this update, IRM will support the discovery of sensitive files and text shared to any cloud application or website (inc. GenAI) via network layer. This capability is based on integration with 3rd party network partners (with data being captured via network layer).

Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, data leakage, and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies based on their own internal policies, governance, and organizational requirements. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Generative AI apps activities as triggers in IRM
items.description:
With this update, the generative AI apps indicators will be supported as triggers in Risky AI usage policy. With triggers, customers can define the conditions for bringing the user into the scope of a policy while the generative AI apps indicators are used to determine risk score.

Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, data leakage, and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies based on their own internal policies, governance, and organizational requirements. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Collection policies impact on IRM
items.description:
With this update, Microsoft Purview will start supporting collection policies. Collection policies allow customers to scope classification (SITs - Sensitive Information Types) and activities for scoped users. We recommend reviewing collection policies as they can be created by different Purview solution admins to ensure they are setup to detect the activities required by IRM policies

Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, data leakage, and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies to manage security and compliance. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance center: Insider Risk Management - Policy scoping enhancements
items.description: After further review, we continue rolling this out. We apologize for any inconvenience. With this release, Insider Risk Management administrators can include or exclude specific users, groups, and adaptive scopes within policies. We are also adding support for non-mail enabled Security Groups within IRM policies. Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, data leakage and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies based on their own internal policies, governance and organizational requirements. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: New Personalization settings
items.description: Microsoft Purview is launching a new Personalization page which will help users personalize their individual experience on Purview.

items.title: Microsoft 365 Copilot: Work from your recent prompts in Draft with Copilot
items.description: Based on what you're typing, Copilot in Word shows your most recent prompts, which you can use as-is or modify in Draft with Copilot.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: New email indicators to alert on exfiltration of business sensitive data to free public
items.description:
In this update, we are adding two new email indicators to Insider Risk Management.
1.  Sending email with attachments to free public domains: This alerts when business-sensitive data is potentially leaked from a work email account to a free public domain email, potentially leading to a data security incident. 

2. Sending email with attachments to self: This alerts when business-sensitive data is potentially leaked from a work email account to user's personal email account or emailing self, potentially leading to a data security incident. 
Admins with appropriate permissions can enable these indicators from the settings page and use these new indicators in the data leaks or data theft policy template.

Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, data leakage, and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies based on their own internal policies, governance, and organizational requirements. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy.

items.title: SharePoint: Design ideas for quick links webpart
items.description: Design Ideas now provides formatting suggestions for the quick links webpart. This includes suggesting icons and images for a given link, as well as showing how the webpart would look with different card sizes, for single quick link webparts in a section.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): In Copilot Pages, the Chat can now be used to modify the Page
items.description: When a Chat and a Page are open side by side, prompts within the Chat can now be used to modify or add to the contents of the Page.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Priority content support for Risky AI usage
items.description:
With this update, Risky AI usage policy template will support priority content. Customers can define Sensitive Info Types (SITs), Trainable Classifiers, Sensitivity Labels as priority content, and get alerted only when the activity matches the selected priority content.

Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, data leakage, and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies based on their own internal policies, governance, and organizational requirements. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Copilot summary for transferred calls
items.description: When a call is forwarded/transferred to another colleague, users can prompt Copilot to automatically summarize the context, open questions, etc. for the call as a briefing for the receiving colleague. This feature ensures that the recipient is well-informed about the previous conversations related to the transferred call, enhancing their understanding and preparedness.

items.title: Outlook: Category Shortcuts in the New Outlook for Windows
items.description: Easily organize your inbox with quick-access category shortcuts! The shortcuts you loved in classic Outlook for Windows will be available in the new Outlook for Windows, making it easier than ever to categorize emails. #newoutlookforwindows

items.title: Microsoft Teams: App ratings in in-context surfaces.
items.description: Now users will be able to view ratings when they view apps within the in-context store in teams.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: eDiscovery - Advanced Review Set Explorer
items.description: The Advanced Review Set Explorer empowers reviewers to harness the power of real-time big data analytics on their review set data leveraging. This tool enhances data analysis by offering insights such as identifying top item types, spotting patterns, and trends within the review set. Reviewers can utilize powerful Kusto query constructs like complex filtering, pattern-based text extraction, and data format parsing to analyze and find key information specific to their case or organization. The results can then be visualized using various flexible charting solutions, providing a comprehensive understanding of the data's story.

items.title: Outlook: Move to in the pop-out ribbon in New Outlook and Outlook for Web
items.description: The "Move To" option is now available in the pop-out ribbon in New Outlook and Outlook for Web, making it easier to organize emails. Quickly move messages to any folder without switching back to the main window. This update ensures a seamless and consistent email management experience.  #newoutlookforwindows

items.title: SharePoint: Design Ideas for Blank Flexible Sections
items.description: When you add a blank flexible section to your page, you will now be able to open up the Design Ideas panel to get blank section suggestions just as you can for standard sections.

items.title: SharePoint: Design Ideas Suggests Images from Org Assets
items.description: SharePoint Design ideas can now pull from your Org Asset images to use within design ideas. If available when performing image suggestion, the first 3 ideas will show suggestions with images from org assets, whereas the rest of the ideas will use stock images.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): UX Transparency for Web Queries
items.description: With UX transparency of web grounding in Copilot, users will now be able to see the exact queries sent by Copilot in response to a user's prompt to the web for grounding, along with the list of websites being queried, enhancing their awareness and control over the process.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Support large documents in Word Copilot
items.description: Support customers referencing large documents

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Introducing new IT administrator policies to control Town hall Event Access
items.description: Previously, Microsoft did not provide a way for Teams admins to control who can attend town halls that are created in their organization. With this new policy, tenant administrators can control who can attend town halls created by members in their organization.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Ability to Stop Copilot while it is generating a response
items.description: Copilot in Teams will now have a 'stop' button after sending a prompt. This will allow the user to stop Copilot's response either before the response has started to generate, or even after the response is generating. The user may then start a new prompt if they wish.

items.title: Outlook: 2-click view of encrypted emails in New Outlook
items.description:
New Outlook for Windows will now support a two-click view for encrypted emails. This feature enables admins to require user confirmation before allowing access to encrypted emails. Admins can find the "TwoClickMailPreviewEnabled" setting in the Microsoft Azure directory. Alternatively, admins can access and set the value for this setting using the Microsoft PowerShell cmdlet "-Set-OrganizationConfiquration" in the Microsoft Exchange Online PowerShell.
#newoutlookforwindows

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Amplify - Multiple column layouts in email
items.description: Viva Amplify authored email will support two column layouts.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Amplify - Animated GIFs in email
items.description: We are bringing animated GIFs to email crafted by Viva Amplify.  GIFs of limited size will appear as animations in Outlook clients.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Learning - Ingestion logs in Viva Learning for SAP SuccessFactors
items.description: This creates LMS ingestion logs for sync summary, user sync, and LRS data. Logs will help admins debug any ingestion-related issues.

items.title: PowerPoint: Designer is now part of Copilot, enhanced with new template and slide Suggestions.
items.description: Designer is now part of Copilot. Copilot Suggestions now brings you familiar Designer slide layout and presentation template suggestions in a vertical gallery, along with new capabilities.

items.title: Microsoft Edge: Secure password deployment in the Edge management service
items.description: The secure password deployment feature in the Edge management service enables admins to deploy encrypted shared passwords to a set of users, allowing them to log into websites seamlessly without ever seeing the actual passwords. This reduces the risk of unauthorized access and enhances the organization's overall security posture.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Control When Shared Content Is Visible to Attendees in 'Manage what attendees see'
items.description: An enhancement to the 'Manage what attendees see' feature, allowing organizers and presenters to control when shared content is visible to attendees. This capability is available for Meetings, Webinars and Town halls.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Loss Prevention - New predicate in Email DLP - Detect number of domains/Recipients
items.description: The "Recipient/Domain Count Over" feature, designed to address a critical need for managing and controlling the distribution of sensitive information via email. This feature allows organizations to set specific policies that trigger alerts or actions when the number of recipients or domains in outgoing emails exceeds a defined threshold. By implementing this feature, organizations can enhance data security, ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, and prevent unauthorized data dissemination, providing peace of mind and safeguarding sensitive information.

items.title: Microsoft 365 admin center: Usage reports - Add Copilot.cloud.microsoft/Teams/Outlook usage for Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat usage report
items.description: This feature allows organizations to monitor Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat adoption in Copilot.cloud.microsoft/Teams/Outlook for users without Microsoft 365 Copilot licenses. It enhances the Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat report by providing metrics on the number of active users of Copilot.cloud.microsoft/Teams/Outlook and the last activity date for each user.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Send messages to attendees in the meeting lobby with lobby chat
items.description: Now meeting organizers can send one-way messages to attendees in the lobby via the lobby chat. The Lobby chat is intended to optimize the lobby experience for all participants, ensuring that organizers are better equipped to run external meetings, have more control over meetings with external participants, and external attendees are well informed about the meeting upon meeting start.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Endpoint Data Loss Prevention- MacOS parity – Full file evidence
items.description: Data Loss Prevention (DLP) can copy the item that matches a DLP policy from onboarded MacOS devices to an Azure storage account. This creates full file evidence parity for MacOS.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Endpoint Data Loss Prevention- Paste to Browser prevention support on macOS device with endpoint DLP
items.description: Microsoft Purview Endpoint Data Loss Prevention adds support on users trying to paste sensitive content into web browsers on macOS devices using Edge, Safari, and other browsers.

items.title: SharePoint: SharePoint agent usage statistics across all SharePoint sites
items.description: SharePoint agents' usage statistics would be aggregated across all SharePoint sites and available for the tenant admin persona.

items.title: OneDrive: OneDrive: New annotation layout and tools for PDF editing
items.description: The new PDF annotation layout features a more intuitive design where all annotation tools are now conveniently located in a single row at the top of the screen. A new type of eraser has been added to allow for more precise editing which can remove annotations pixel by pixel.

items.title: Outlook: External tag in contact suggestions
items.description: An "External" tag will be added to contact suggestions that appear in the dropdown when entering contacts in the email compose form in the new Outlook for Windows. #newoutlookforwindows

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Ask Copilot to rewrite text as a list
items.description: Copilot in PowerPoint will rewrite paragraphs into bullet points or lists.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot Extensibility - Admins can manage Copilot extensibility under Copilot tab in Microsoft 365 admin center
items.description: Admins have options to manage Copilot extensibility under Copilot tab including agent management for IT published agents and shared agents.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Information Protection: SharePoint Online extends library permissions to downloaded files
items.description: This new capability ties together SharePoint Online library permissions with Purview sensitivity labeling and protection. SharePoint Online document library owners can set a label on the library, automatically applying that label to all unprotected and unlabeled Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and PDF files in the target library. Files downloaded from these libraries are protected at download. Users accessing these files outside of SharePoint Online have their rights evaluated in real time against the document library. Changes to user permissions on the document library are reflected on downloaded files, including full revocation for users removed from the document library. This provides a more centralized information worker-managed permission model that also offers revocation capabilities at a user level, rather than per-document.

items.title: Microsoft Edge: Updated Work feed on the new tab page
items.description: The Work feed experience, available on the new tab page for Work feed-eligible Commercial users with a Microsoft 365 subscription, will have changing and updated functionalities. These changes include renewed focus on productivity and Microsoft 365 modules. Users will have an updated My Feed experience on the enterprise new tab page. Users will no longer be able to view content and activity from their network and instead will experience quick access to recently used Microsoft 365 documents, recent SharePoint sites, upcoming Outlook events, Microsoft 365 apps, and Microsoft To Do tasks. Existing new tab page policies will continue to be enforced and will not be impacted by this updated Work feed experience.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): M365 Copilot for GCC Environments: Wave 2
items.description: Bringing Microsoft 365 Copilot GCC your AI assistant for work in the GCC environment. It combines the power of Large Language Models with your work content and context, to help you draft and rewrite, summarize and organize, catch up on what you missed, and get answers to questions via open prompts. Copilot generates answers using the rich, people-centric data and insights available in the Microsoft Graph. Microsoft 365 Copilot GCC is now available in Stream, SharePoint, OneNote, and Pages in Loop.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Users can view app ratings before installing apps or agents
items.description: We have improved user options for sharing a link for a Teams app or a Microsoft 365 Copilot agent in a chat. Links to apps and agents will have a new preview card with user ratings for users to consider before installing apps or agents in Teams and clear actions like Add (which installs the app or agent) and View detail. A Microsoft 365 Copilot license is not required to share Copilot agent links but may be required to install and use the agent.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Share apps from app bar via right click
items.description: Allow users to right-click and share apps directly from the app icon on hover, while using the app.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: App ratings will be available in the unfurled links
items.description: App ratings will appear on the unfurled links for shared apps and agents to allow users who rely on ratings to evaluate apps prior to installing.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Ask Copilot to rewrite text as a list
items.description: Copilot in PowerPoint will rewrite paragraphs into bullet points or lists.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Local PTZ camera controls for Microsoft Teams Rooms on Android
items.description: If the camera is not currently auto-framing the room, in-room users can now control the Pan-Tilt-Zoom (PTZ) of the active camera to keep the focus where they want it.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Endpoint DLP support - Just-in-time on MacOS
items.description: You can use Endpoint data loss prevention (DLP) just-in-time (JIT) protection to block all egress activities on monitored files while waiting for policy evaluation to successfully complete. When JIT protection is enabled, and while policy evaluation is processing, Endpoint DLP blocks all egress activities for each user whose account is in the selected scope. Endpoint DLP audits the egress activities for all user accounts that have been excluded (via the Exclude setting) or are otherwise not in scope.

items.title: SharePoint: Restricted Access Control Enhancements
items.description: New enhancements for RAC policy for SharePoint administrators to restrict access to SharePoint sites including managing M365 group connected sites with M365 groups or Security groups.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Ask Copilot to rewrite text as a list
items.description: Copilot in PowerPoint will rewrite paragraphs into bullet points or lists.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Copilot only during call
items.description: Copilot is only available during the live call session and will not be accessible after the call ends. No recording or transcription is required to use Copilot during the call.

items.title: Microsoft Teams:  Simplified Notes pane in meetings
items.description: We’re updating the Notes pane in meetings to streamline the design and make key controls more clear. First, we’re renaming the header from ‘Meeting notes’ to ‘Notes’ to match the pane’s name in the meeting toolbar.  Second, the file-level controls like “Open in new window” and “Copy component” are combined into a single header at the top for simplicity. As part of the single header, the control to open the component in the Loop web app will be found in the ellipses menu in the top header and no longer in the Pages icon.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Opening Calls in a small window in Teams
items.description: Allowing users to open calls in a small window to reduce disruptions in Teams.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Translated Intelligent meeting recap for multilingual meetings (Copilot and Teams Premium)
items.description: Now, intelligent meeting recap supports multilingual meetings, ensuring you can easily catch up on key discussions even when multiple languages were spoken. After the meeting, your recap is automatically generated in the translation language you selected for live transcription and captions.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Meeting organizers can enable transcription in multilingual meetings (Copilot and Teams Premium)
items.description: We’re introducing a new organizer-level control that no longer requires all meetings to have one common spoken language to be set across all participants. Meeting organizers with Copilot or Teams Premium licenses will see a new control in meeting options called “Enable multilingual speech recognition.” When this is enabled before a meeting, each meeting participant will be able to set their own spoken language during the meeting, and the meeting transcript can accurately reflect each participant’s language of choice.

items.title: Outlook: Schedule from email with Copilot
items.description: Often you may want to transition a conversation from an email thread to a meeting. Copilot helps you do this by being able to start scheduling right from the email conversation. It saves you time and effort by generating a meeting invite that's ready for you to review and send. When you click on "Schedule with Copilot" a meeting form will appear with a Copilot generated meeting title, agenda, and conversation summary as well as a pre-filled attendee list from the email thread and an attachment of the original email thread. This feature will be available in the new Outlook for Windows, web, Mac, and mobile. #newoutlookforwindows

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Copilot in Teams meetings responses can be exported to Word and Excel
items.description: Now, certain responses from Copilot in Teams meetings will have an option to ‘edit in’ Word or Excel. The ‘edit in’ option for Word will be available for Copilot responses that are long (more than 1300 characters) and will automatically open a Word document with the response written. The ‘edit in’ option for Excel will be available for Copilot responses that are formatted in a table, and will automatically open an Excel file with the formatted response added. Copilot responses can only be exported if the meeting policy for the meeting is set to allow copying or forwarding of meeting chat, live captions, transcript, and Copilot responses. The export capability will also inherit the sensitivity label of the meeting (sensitivity labels are available to Teams Premium users).

items.title: Windows 365: Users can authenticate to Windows 365 using passkeys (FIDO2) on Android
items.description: This allows Windows 365 users to use passkeys (FIDO2) on Android. This feature will align with Windows App on Android GA.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot uses Enterprise assets hosted on Templafy when creating presentations with Copilot
items.description: Once you connect your asset library hosted with Templafy to Microsoft 365 and Copilot, you will be able to create presentations with your organization's images.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Modern eDiscovery enhancements
items.description: We are introducing several enhancements to the eDiscovery modernized user interface. These updates include a comprehensive case-level data source view, the ability to retry failed locations for a more complete search statistics estimate. Users will also be able to duplicate search and copy search from hold or hold from search within the same case, reusing the data sources and queries. Additionally, customers will be able to access a more comprehensive reporting in all process reports including information like compliance boundary, encryption settings and more.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Standard and Basic licensed Teams rooms on Windows in the Pro Management portal
items.description: The Teams Rooms Pro Management portal now supports and enforces licenses for devices in Teams Rooms on Windows with a Standard or Basic license. IT admins get a unified device management experience through the Pro Management portal where they can manage those devices with the same functionality found in Teams admin center for that license type.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Enhancing usability for the frontline
items.description: We are enhancing the default experience for Frontline Workers by making it easier to connect with their organization and introducing more intuitive app names. These updates include adding the Viva Engage experience into the Tailored Frontline App Experience and renaming Viva Connections to Home for greater clarity.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Support for summarization of very long documents
items.description: Copilot in Word can summarize documents up to about 1,500,000 words or 3,000 pages. This summary will be available on top of the document.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Support for summarization of very long documents
items.description: Copilot in Word can summarize documents up to about 1,500,000 words or 3,000 pages. This summary will be available on top of the document.

items.title: Microsoft 365 admin center: Usage reports - SharePoint storage insights, actions, and resources
items.description: A new Storage tab will be added to usage report for SharePoint within the Microsoft 365 admin center. The new tab will provide visibility into storage quota consumption, a usage trend, and recommended actions and resources for storage management and optimization

items.title: Outlook: MIP sensitivity label support S/MIME in new Outlook for Windows
items.description: New Outlook for Windows will support S/MIME (Secure/Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions) signing and encryption as an outcome of sensitivity labels. Admins can use set label advanced setting to define the label to have S/MIME sign or encryption or both, and emails with those labels applied will enforce S/MIME sign and encrypt accordingly. #newoutlookforwindows

items.title: OneDrive: OneDrive files as knowledge sources for agents
items.description: Allow files from OneDrive to be added as a grounding source in the Sources tab when creating a custom agent. This would apply to agents created from both OneDrive and SharePoint.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Copilot generated summaries for call transfers on Teams phone devices
items.description: Copilot generated summary provides an overview of the details and outcomes of transferred calls. It includes information such as the caller's details, the reason for the transfer, and the final resolution.

items.title: Outlook: Agents in Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat in Outlook on the Web and the new Outlook for Windows
items.description: Declarative Agents have already rolled out to Microsoft 365 Copilot chat, with this update we will be adding support for the same set of agents in Copilot chat in Outlook too. #newoutlookforwindows

items.title: Windows 365: Available from New Zealand North
items.description: Windows 365 will be available in New Zealand North.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot uses enterprise assets hosted on SharePoint OAL when creating presentations with Copilot
items.description: Once you integrate your organization's assets into a Sharepoint OAL (Organization Asset Library) you will be able to create presentations with your organization's images

items.title: Outlook: Open previous email with Email Auto-advance
items.description: This feature allows users to automatically open the message above the current one in the message list after performing actions like moving or deleting the current message. Users can turn this behavior on in the "Email Auto-advance" Mail setting.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Policy sync status on Purview portal
items.description: The Policy Sync Status feature enables solution admins to know the policy sync status directly from the Policy page in Purview portal. When a policy is created or updated by a user, the changes are distributed to the locations selected. This new feature will give users insight into whether the policy changes have reached the target locations. This policy sync status feature is available for DLP (excluding endpoint policies), Information Protection, Data Loss Management, Records Management, Information Barriers, and Priva.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Endpoint Data Loss Prevention - Add hyperlink support in warn and block toast messages
items.description: With this feature, data officers can now embed hyperlinks within toast messages for specific rules. When this rule is triggered, the end user will see a toast with a customized title and message with a hyperlink. This feature is useful when organizations need to direct users to a specific resource or a repository for more specific instruction (e.g. internal policy SharePoint site).

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Pulse - Pulse users can assign other users as delegates
items.description: Viva Pulse users can now assign other users as delegates to create and send pulses on their behalf.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Audio summary of your file
items.description: Copilot can generate audio summaries of your file, making information easy to consume anywhere.

items.title: Microsoft Teams: GCC High support in Teams Rooms Pro Management
items.description: The Pro Management service and admin portal is now available for GCC High customer tenants.

items.title: Microsoft 365 admin center: Usage reports - Microsoft 365 Copilot for GCC Moderate
items.description: We will be introducing a new Usage report covering Microsoft 365 Copilot. This report will include total enabled and active users, Copilot usage with a breakout per Microsoft 365 app, and user-level activity insights (anonymized by default). #copilotcontrolsystem

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Amplify - Audience breakdown tooltip
items.description: Amplify reports will provide a breakdown of the channels shown in the Unique viewers card. The tool tip will show the top 5 channel audiences and their contribution to the overall numbers for each publication channel presented in the report.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot Chat now offers meeting series selection on CIQ Menu
items.description: Users will now be able to select meeting series and related instances from CIQ to submit as part of their prompts to Copilot Chat.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): The chat experience now offers better search refinement on CIQ menu Files tab
items.description: Following further review, this feature continues in development. We apologize for any inconvenience. Users will now be able to use File Type filters and People refiners to apply search criteria to get to relevant files faster in the CIQ menu.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Rich artifacts in Copilot Pages
items.description: You can now create rich artifacts, including interactive charts, tables, complex diagrams, and code created with Copilot from enterprise or web data. Artifacts can be added to Pages to further edit and refine with Copilot. They are interactive and stay in sync across Microsoft 365 when shared for collaborative work.

items.title: SharePoint: OneDrive and SharePoint – Protect PDF with password
items.description: SharePoint and OneDrive users can now secure their PDF files by adding protection that restricts unauthorized access through OneDrive Web. This feature allows you to set an open password, which is required to access the PDF, or an owner password, which sets permissions for actions such as printing or editing the document. This ensures your files remain secure and only accessible to authorized individuals

items.title: Microsoft Teams: Intelligent recap for calls from chat and ‘Meet now’ meetings now available for GCC High
items.description: Intelligent meeting recap will be available in GCC High for impromptu calls and meetings, like those started from ‘Meet now’ and calls started from chat. You can easily browse the recording by speakers and topics, as well as access AI-generated notes, AI-generated tasks, and name mentions after the ad-hoc meeting ends. This capability will be available for users with a Teams Premium or M365 Copilot license.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Enhanced Copilot in Engage
items.description: Copilot in Engage has now been integrated with M365,providing the same rich access to the M365 Graph, and helping you natively access Microsoft data in the flow of Engage.  Alongside this update, you can expect improved AI-powered writing assistance that bring in email/chat/files data to help craft both the content and style of your message

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Introducing the New Republish Feature in Viva Amplify
items.description: We’re excited to launch Republish, a new feature that keeps your content fresh, extends its reach, and maximizes engagement across SharePoint, Viva Engage, Outlook, and Teams. Update existing published content in a few clicks, re-share key messages to new audiences or channels, correct errors and refine your messaging —all without starting from scratch. Republish in Viva Amplify makes content management effortless.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Glint - Self service for historical imports
items.description: This feature will introduce an alternative solution to the existing Advanced Configurations feature that allows an Admin to perform historical imports into the Viva Glint platform. This alternate reduces the number of needed files and offers a simplified user experience to bring historical data into Viva Glint.

items.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Glint - Self service for retroactive updates
items.description: This feature will introduce an alternative solution to the existing Advanced Configurations feature that allows an Admin to retroactively update simpler attribute scenarios associated to surveys. This alternate provides a friendly user experience in a new wizard format - and as well as offering the option to perform the feature with zero file uploads.

items.title: Microsoft 365: Long-term retention period for M365 Backup
items.description: This creates the ability to set longer term retention periods to restore beyond one year.

items.title: SharePoint: Chat one-on-one with SharePoint agents in Teams
items.description: Users can chat one-on-one with a SharePoint agent directly within Teams chat.

items.title: Outlook: Copilot Pages – View, edit & share in Outlook Mobile
items.description: Continue working with Copilot and colleagues while on the go, with the ability to view, edit and share Pages on mobile.

items.title: Outlook: Agents for Microsoft 365 Copilot available in Copilot Chat in classic Outlook for Windows
items.description: We will be adding declarative agents support for agents in Copilot Chat in Outlook. This roadmap item tracks availability in classic Outlook for Windows.

items.title: Whiteboard: Sticky notes accelerator
items.description: Sticky note accelerators will help users work faster in Whiteboard by simplifying adding sticky notes. With a single click, users can quickly add sticky notes, making brainstorming and collaboration seamless.

items.title: OneDrive: Annotate with Apple Pencil Experience on OneDrive for iOS
items.description: Annotating with hand-drawn content in the OneDrive apps for iOS and iPadOS is now easier than ever. Enjoy various types of annotation tools and expressive strokes that match your pressure.

items.title: SharePoint: Card animation
items.description: Card animation will enable motion for web parts on Pages and News.

items.title: Outlook: Time Suggestions assistance while creating new meetings
items.description: Get assistance with time suggestions when creating new meetings in modern Outlook. This feature is currently supported for non-recurring meetings only. #newoutlookforwindows

items.title: Windows 365: Local desktop access for Windows 365 Boot user
items.description: This feature enables end users to return to their physical PC using the CTRL-ALT-DEL screen or from Cloud PC error screens when their device is in Boot mode. Administrators can configure and customize this feature within the Guided Scenario for Boot.

items.title: Windows 365: Available from Mexico Central, Spain Central
items.description: Windows 365 will be available in Mexico Central and Spain Central.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365):  Microsoft Copilot Chat and Microsoft 365 Copilot - Users can insert cloud files in Copilot chat prompts.
items.description: In the Web tab in Microsoft 365 Copilot and in Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat, users can access Microsoft One Drive or Microsoft SharePoint to find and insert cloud files in their prompts.

items.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Endpoint Data Loss Prevention –  Configure network share groups using IP or IP address range
items.description: With this feature, data officers can now configure specific IP addresses or IP address ranges in DLP Settings within Sensitive service domain groups to be used in DLP policies for more precise scoping.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Create a PowerPoint slide from a file or prompt
items.description: Creating impactful slides can be challenging and time-consuming. Copilot helps you quickly turn your ideas and files into a fully designed slide with content ready to edit and refine, making the presentation creation and refinement process more personalized and efficient.

items.title: SharePoint: Microsoft 365 Archive file-level archiving
items.description: This introduces archiving at the file level for Microsoft 365 Archive.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Search past sessions in Copilot Chat
items.description: Search through your past Copilot conversations in Copilot Chat.

items.title: Add multiple SharePoint agents in a single Teams conversation
items.description: Users can include more than one SharePoint agent as a participant in a Teams group chat, meeting chat, or channel.

items.title: SharePoint: SharePoint agents are available in Teams app Store
